job_description: Job DescriptionGeneral Dynamics Information Technology – Federal Civilian Division is currently looking for a Data Analyst. The position support our Continuing Education Program and Event Planning Logistical Support contract and it is based in Silver Spring, Maryland. ResponsibilitiesCollects and manages event planning data. Ensures all data is current and accurate.Develops trackers, reports and other necessary tools utilizing Microsoft Excel.Prepares, reviews, and researches technical information for contract deliverables and ensure accuracy of information reported and adherence to standards of quality.Responsible for monitoring and downloading metrics from continuing education provider and Interactive Customer Evaluation systems. Ensure all data is properly quality control checked and disseminated to the team. Update customer metric reports and spreadsheets after data is made available per established timeframes. Upload reports to the SharePoint website and disseminate information to team members as requested.Analyzes and identifies problems and solutions that afford maximum probability for success and effectiveness through data collection, management, and analysis.Prepares analytical findings in a concise and high level manner. Produces clear and concise reports relevant to customer needs for reporting to senior leadership.Develops After Action Reports and/or comprehensive evaluation reports within established timeframes.Follows best practices as they relate to virtual learning events and collecting metrics.Reviews and provides analysis of survey responses to aid in the development of educational content topics for upcoming events.Identifies areas for process improvement in current practices and suggests ways to apply these changes.Provides technical and administrative support to project management and team members on assigned tasks.Attends meetings with centers to determine data collection and reporting needs and provide specific reports based on their criteria. Back briefs customer and team members when necessary through detailed meeting minutes.Maintains current knowledge of the events schedule and assists in the preparation of event specific task lists for individual events in collaboration with each functional area.May provide guidance and work leadership to less-experienced analysts. Keeps team informed of Government customer’s actions, expectations, and schedules.Participates in special projects as required and remains flexible as priorities and tasks tend to shift quickly. Must be able to move from priority to priority per the PM to best support the customer and team in the current state.Serves as liaison between customer and CE provider to determine the most effective methods for reporting event demographics and CEs provided.Local travel required for some events. EducationMaster’s Degree in Statistics, Economics, Public Health, Epidemiology or related field.5-8 years of related experience in scientific, customer-specific research and analysis.Experience working with the military and federal government preferred.Experience working with learning management system. QualificationsComprehensive knowledge of the principles, methods, equipment/systems and techniques used in scientific functional area(s).Expertise with commercial software products such as Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Access, Excel, PowerPoint and Word, SQL Server, etc. for the use of creating reports and products.Must possess effective listening, verbal and written communication skills.Demonstrated experience and ability to apply multiple organizational and management improvement techniques within government environments.Flexible team member who thrives in environments requiring ability to effectively prioritize, multitask, and judge concurrent projects in a demanding, fast-paced work environment.Strong analytical and organizational skills; must be detail oriented. Adept at gathering requirements with ability to adapt to changes in requirementsShows initiative and ability to work independently and as a team using problem solving skills.Ability to build rapport and trusting relationships with customer and team members As a trusted systems integrator for more than 50 years, General Dynamics Information Technology provides information technology (IT), systems engineering, professional services and simulation and training to customers in the defense, federal civilian government, health, homeland security, intelligence, state and local government and commercial sectors. With approximately 32,000 professionals worldwide, the company delivers IT enterprise solutions, manages large-scale, mission-critical IT programs and provides mission support services. GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class  #HCSDCJ  #DICE

Job Summary:Analyzes billing and coding data and creates high-level reports to identify trends for senior management upon request.Duties and Responsibilities:Collects, compiles, manages and analyzes data as it is available and obtainable that relates to the various programs within the Revenue Cycle Management, Coding, Billing, and Clinical Documentation Integrity divisions of the practice.Data can include but is not limited to:Coding Metrics and DistributionsFeedback TrendsPayor TrendsOther Data and Metrics as applicableDevelops and maintains monthly reporting tools that reflect the progress of efforts and trends, and provides and/or presents feedback to senior management.Participates in special projects to enhance business process efficiency and effectiveness.Works with Alteon IT leadership to bring the RCM divisions data needs in line with overall practice goals.Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:Ability to speak, write, and read English fluently; ability to communicate clearly and effectively both orally and in writing.Proactive approach to identifying and solving problems in your areas of responsibilities.Accurate, detail oriented, well organized and able to multitask.Ability to communicate thoughts clearly, to file accurately, and to retain information.Must be able to work effectively both independently and with others.Follows all compliance plan standards and department policies and procedures.Must have proficient computer skills and be fluent in Excel, Access, SQL, and have the ability to work with multiple coding & billing-related software products.Education & Experience:The above knowledge, skills, and abilities may be demonstrated by an individual with a Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, IT, Business, or a related field. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel required; database management and statistical knowledge base preferred.

Boeing Intelligence & Analytics (BI&A) is a leading provider of strategic capabilities to the United States Intelligence Community. We help Customers identify and develop strategies to counter the strengths and exploit the vulnerabilities of potential adversaries. We provide technical expertise across the entire mission spectrum from requirements definition and system and software development to system integration, test and deployment. BI&A maintains top-tier technical talent and industry expertise in software engineering, systems integration and development, rapid prototyping, and project leadership. We pride ourselves on the proven ability to support our Customers while understanding the importance of work – life balance. Intelligence Analyst Location: DC - Washington Job Code: 4375 # of Openings: 5 Division Overview: For over 8 years, we have provided support to our Intelligence Community (IC) Customers in applying the TAC tool to their intelligence requirements. Our Customers are threat-based and intelligence-driven organizations. The missions typically include areas such as counter-intelligence; upholding and enforcing the criminal laws of the United States; providing intelligence support for homeland security; cyber intelligence and operations; and intelligence related activities for protecting national assets.  Clearance Requirements: Clearance: TS/SCI DescriptionIntelligence Analyst – Top Secret SCIBoeing Intelligence & Analytics ("BI&A"), a subsidiary to The Boeing Company, is seeking a Intelligence Analyst to join their high-caliber team.Job Description:Assists Intelligence Community customers in using the Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA) TAC data discovery system to support their intelligence requirements by:* Working closely with the customer on developing information requests and expressing them as queries and grids to support the customers ’ day to day operations* Providing desk-side assistance by analyzing case-specific data and recommending queries and analytic grid frameworks to persistently monitor the essential elements of interest to customers* Building search queries, grid sets to support case teams when requested* Providing training on use of the system for customer personnel in settings such as classrooms, desk-side assistance, collaboration using web tools, or telephone support. * Conducting content administration/query quality control of the analytic query database* Administering customer use accounts for the TAC system* Assisting the Boeing program manager in preparation of formal reports* Collaborating with Boeing analysts on similar contracts as well as customer program managers to ensure clear lines of communications and expectations.* Traveling to customer CONUS and OCONUS sites to provide training or TAC user support on-site at field locations. TDY requirements are estimated up to 20%.Education:Bachelors Degree or the equivalent combination of education, professional training or work experience.Qualifications:At least six (6) years of experience in an intelligence discipline or related environment (e.g. all source analysis, full motion video (FMV) analysis, human intelligence (HUMINT), signals intelligence (SIGINT), imagery intelligence (IMINT), measurement and signatures intelligence (MASINT), open-source intelligence (OSINT), geospatial intelligence (GEOINT))Key Role:The Intelligence Analyst supports the customer mission by assisting with creation of queries and grids, creating queries and grids as requested, providing training on the use of the TAC system, and assisting with administration of user accounts on the system.Required Skills:* Proficiency in the analytic employment of computer-based analysis or query tools in an intelligence setting* Experience in providing training on the use of analytic tools in environments such as classrooms, small group or desk-side analytic mentor training sessions, through use of on-line collaboration tools, or telephonically.Desired Skills:* Experience using the TAC tool or as a TAC Systems Specialist* Experience using intelligence analysis or research tools such as Palantir, Analyst Notebook, Multi-media Message Manager (M3), Distributed Common Ground System (DCGS), Modernized Integrated Database (MIDB), Combined Information Data Network Exchange (CIDNE), Terrorist Identities Datamart Environment (TIDE), PRISM, Intelink / Intellipedia, CIAWire, NSANet * Working knowledge of all source analysis as applied to analytic problem sets.* Self-starter and team builder with excellent communication, leadership and organizational skills.* Ability to keep accurate and up to date administrative records.* Ability to project and log long term training requirements and schedules* Ability to represent the Company to clients, and to shape and advocate for client requirements.Clearance:Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information and submit to a polygraph; TS/SCI clearance is required. Boeing Intelligence & Analytics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.EEO Is the Law Back to Search Results Are you a returning applicant? A division of Intersections Inc., Identity Guard is a leading provider of identity risk management, privacy protection and other subscription based services for consumers. Our core services monitor personal information for our consumers, aggregate it into digestible, consumer-friendly reports and alerts, and provide personalized education and support to help our customers understand their information and take the actions they deem appropriate. Since its business was founded in 1996, Intersections has helped protect the identities of more than 47 million consumers.  Do you love data, solving problems, and predicting the future? Do you know more math than a programmer and more about programming than a mathematician? Are you interested in using data to answer hard questions and generate value in a competitive market sector? We need someone who can do just that.  As a Data Scientist and Business Analyst you will be responsible for supporting multiple aspects of the development and implementation of products for personal privacy protection. In the Data Scientist portion of this role, you will regularly collaborate with both technical and business resources to apply data science to ensure product quality. The Business Analyst part will allow you to also evaluate the customer value of products and services and ensure user experience expectations are being met. The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter who thrives on using data to answer difficult questions, is not afraid to wear many hats, and can take on additional responsibilities as business needs dictate. Evaluate new data sources, assessing the quality and value of data attributes. Perform exploratory data analysis to verify such value.Work with the technical team to develop methods for integrating available data into new or existing products.Design, develop, and maintain consumer- and business-facing predictive models.Analyze the impact new data sources will have on product quality; periodically assess the quality and impact of continuing to use existing sources.Define requirements as user stories and acceptance criteria for integrating new data into predictive models.Support and troubleshoot customer-facing user experience and back office production issues.Keep up on recent news impacting consumer data to provide better recommendations for customer needs.Collaborate with developers and operations to transition business process ownership and support to other departments, allowing Product Development team to focus on continuously improving product offerings.Actively participate in all aspects of Agile/Scrum practices including daily standups, design sessions, grooming and sprint planning sessions, sprint reviews and retrospectives.Create documentation as needed for new or updated processes.Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Economics, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics or related quantitative discipline required1-3 years of experience in a statistics, data analysis, or data science roleExceptional quantitative background demonstrated through academic and professional credentialsHigh degree of analytical and technical aptitude with well-developed problem solving skills is a mustSome experience with programming or scripting languages (Java, C, C++, Ruby, Perl, Python, Matlab, R, cURL, etc.) is highly desirableBasic familiarity with machine learning techniques and algorithm design is desirableFamiliarity with relational database concepts and ability to write SQL queries (e.g. MySQL Workbench)Experience working with Agile/Scrum methodologies and the Atlassian product suite (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Bamboo, etc.) preferred, but not required Intersections and its subsidiaries participate in E-Verify. Click here to learn more about this program. EOE M/F/D/V

About EAB  EAB is an education best practices firm that uses a combination of research, technology, and services to improve the performance of 1,200+ educational institutions. Headquartered in Washington, D.C., EAB forges and finds the best new ideas and proven practices from its network of thousands of leaders, then customizes and hardwires them into every level of member organizations, creating enduring value.  At EAB, we serve not only our members but each other—that's why we are always working to make sure our employees love their jobs and are invested in their community. See how we've been recognized for this dedication to our employees by checking out our recent awards.  For more information, visit our Careers page.  The Role in Brief Business Analyst, Associate The Business Analyst manages a pool of clients through the technical implementation of the technology's web based platform. The Business Analyst manages the client relationship, sets and executes against project milestones, and manages the quality, client satisfaction and engagement throughout the implementation lifecycle. The Business Analyst is also responsible for contributing to the team's process improvement efforts, and finding innovative ways to make positive impacts to the business.  This role is based in Washington, DC.  Primary Responsibilities:  - Effectively manage technical projects for a portfolio of clients Design and lead implementation strategy based on institutional structure and data availabilityPartner with clients technical staff, to extract and validate dataAssist team in improving process, and developing scalable solutionsAnalyze client data for validity, identify trends and statistical significanceMaster the functionality of the Student Success platform and develop expertise in industry/product terrainFoster executive level relationships within the institutionFacilitate phone calls and in person presentations with client Basic Qualifications:  - Bachelors Degree 1 year of continuous work experienceValid Drivers LicenseWillingness to travel up to 30% domesticallyAttention to detailService orientationAbility to work in a collaborative environmentStrong communication skillsDemonstrable analytical reasoning and problem solving abilityTime management skills  Ideal Qualifications:- Relevant project management experienceExperience working with analytic tools (Excel, SQL, UNIX)Client management experience- Demonstrates personal responsibility and assertiveness  Benefits  Consistent with our belief that our employees are our most valuable resource, EAB offers a competitive benefits package.Medical, dental, and vision insurance, dependents eligible401(k) retirement plan with company matchGenerous PTODaytime leave policy for community service or fitness activities (up to 10 hours a month each)Wellness programs including gym discounts and incentives to promote healthy livingDynamic growth opportunities with merit-based promotion philosophyBenefits kick in day one, see the full details here.

The Water Environment Federation is seeking a Data Specialist to join its Membership team. This position will be responsible for ensuring WEF’s membership data and reports have integrity and validity; responsible for running reports to help validate data and assisting with monthly cleanup processes; assisting with the creation of membership reports and queries for WEF membership projects, dues, and renewals; responsible for ensuring data accuracy, identifying and resolving critical barriers and issues with membership data; providing overall AMS-related project support to the WEF Membership Department; providing WEF’s local member associations with required queries and monthly reports; and assisting with troubleshooting, as necessary.Principal Functions:Generates weekly and monthly reports to help the Sr. Director and Sr. Manager track membership recruitment and retention progress.Performs regular quality control reviews on membership data to assure the maintenance of high-quality data; corrects data (as necessary) in the AMS.Maintain database integrity through regular audits of membership data entered by external customer service vendor, which includes conducting weekly quality assurance on the database. Includes, but is not limited to, reviewing new membership records created, address updates, contact entry, etc.Assists with monthly renewal billing for membership.Responsible for inputting of market codes and data for membership recruitment campaigns.Generates and delivers accurate AMS reports and list requests for membership recruitment, retention, and reinstatement campaigns.Works collaboratively with Membership and Information Technology teams to prepare and update standard operating procedures (SOPs) involving membership data processes.Distributes monthly e-mail renewal reminders to expiring members.Generates, reviews and reconciles assigned standard month-end reports accurately and distribute to appropriate team members or member associations.Manages weekly exception reports to flag data anomalies to ensure accurate data entry and online processing for member data and payments.Assists the Senior Manager of Membership with annual Exhibitor renewal process to include generation of invoices and mailing list.Works with Senior Director of Membership & Customer Relations on the annual dues renewal process to include generating data for dues report, updating dues amount in AMS, contacting MA’s with missing dues information and performing data input quality checks.Proactively make recommendations and suggestions to Senior Director, Membership & Customer Relations on member data process improvements and additional reporting recommendations.Provides support for other membership data-related tasks, as necessary.Qualifications: Associate or bachelor’s degree in business or related field.Minimum 2-4 years’ experience in a membership association or similar organization managing chapters or affiliates is required.Experience in the preparation and fulfillment of data reports required.Experience and understanding of reconciling chapter or affiliate dues desirable.Experience with Aptify, Personify, iMIS or NetForum Enterprise AMS preferred.Strong ability to synthesize and analyze information.Demonstrated ability to develop good relationships with members and co-workers. Must be comfortable working within a highly, collaborative team.Robust attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills.Strong attention to detail and accuracy of information, including the ability to organize and analyze large amounts of data.Excellent customer-service ethic and responsiveness.Ability to work collaboratively in formal teams and informal working groups, as well as independently.Ability to work well under pressure, determine priorities, and produce results.Excellent organizational skills. Must be detail-oriented and strong multi-tasking ability, often with tight and/or changing deadlines.Solid skills in Microsoft Office applications, including Excel, Word, Outlook and other productivity tools.Strong written and oral communication skills and able to present information persuasively to different audiences.Must demonstrate accuracy and seek to improve/promote quality in the organization while exhibiting objectivity and openness to others’ views.This person will work primarily in an office environment using standard office equipment. Please submit cover letter and salary requirements to WEFrecruitment@wef.orgWEF is an equal opportunity employer

Full timePOSITION OVERVIEW:  Bloomberg BNA provides legal, tax and compliance professionals with critical information, practical guidance and workflow solutions. We leverage leading technology and a global network of experts to deliver a unique combination of news and authoritative analysis, comprehensive research solutions, innovative practice tools, and proprietary business data and analytics. Bloomberg BNA is an affiliate of Bloomberg L.P., the global business, financial information and news leader.  Bloomberg BNA seeks a Research Analyst, Regulatory to monitor and write summaries of federal and state regulatory developments and conduct basic custom research and write reports for BBNA customers. Perform other custom research and regulatory monitoring duties as needed. RESPONSIBILITIES: Review and summarize federal and state regulatory developments on environment and safety, tax, health care, securities, banking, and labor and employment issues and enter into database.Research, write and prepare custom reports for BBNA customers on topics including HR, payroll, environment and safety, and health care.Communicate with Bloomberg BNA customers over the telephone and by email.Contact outside information sources to ensure completeness and accuracy of internal databases.Research and prepare white papers on assigned topics.Participate in special projects; and perform other duties as assigned.REQUIREMENTS:  2+ years’ experience in research and writing comprehensive reports and summary documents; experience summarizing legislative and regulatory developments desired; ability to identify, understand, and summarize complex information from a variety of sources; excellent verbal and written communication skills, including excellent command of English grammar, spelling, punctuation, and syntax; ability to work quickly, accurately, and efficiently in an atmosphere of shifting priorities; ability to respond to constructive criticism and incorporate suggestions; work effectively as a member of a team, including helping others as needed; ability to deal with internal and external customers in a professional manner; excellent organizational skills; ability to work independently; ability to conduct research with guidance from supervisor or higher-level analyst; experience using database software and/or desktop publishing systems desired; basic knowledge of federal and state regulatory processes; knowledge of relevant subjects, including securities, banking, environment and safety, health care, labor relations, employment, HR, payroll, and tax desired; basic proofreading skills; and accurate keyboarding skills. Candidates may be required to pass a test for this position. Bloomberg BNA is an affiliate of Bloomberg L.P., the global business, financial information and news leader. Its network of more than 2,500 reporters, correspondents, and leading practitioners delivers expert analysis, news, practice tools, and guidance — the information that matters most to professionals. Bloomberg BNA’s authoritative coverage spans the full range of legal practice areas, including tax & accounting, labor & employment, intellectual property, banking & securities, employee benefits, health care, privacy & security, human resources, and environment, health & safety.  Bloomberg BNA offers a comprehensive benefits package including tuition reimbursement, domestic partner benefits, transportation subsidies, annual and sick leave, parenting leave, 401(k), and much more.  Bloomberg BNA IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER and fully subscribes to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity. Bloomberg BNA has adopted an Affirmative Action Program to ensure that all applicants and employees are considered for hire, promotion, and job status without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital or familial status, genetic information, disabled veteran, veteran, veteran of the Vietnam Era, or any other classification protected by law. PSI Title: Data Analyst Work Location: VA - Arlington DescriptionEssential Functions and Job Responsibilities: Data Analyst will support the Army National Guard’s Surgeon General’s Office. The successful candidate's core responsibilities will include, but not to be limited to:Apply knowledge of IT systems generally and analytic tools/languages specifically, including Excel, SQL, and Tableau.Develop formats and present reports and graphic presentations of data and support department managers in development of scorecards/dashboards.Review data and reports for trends, common themes, and opportunities for improvement. American Institutes for Research (AIR) is a leading professional services firm with a growing software engineering and product development team. We design and build things that are inspiring and make a real impact in the online testing industry. job_title: Data Analyst, Quantitative Research- Education Practice
job_description: Data Analyst, Quantitative Research— Education Practice AreaHanover ResearchThe Role The Data Analyst will be responsible for the production of quantitative research reports and strategic briefings on an extremely wide variety of education research topics. This position will allow for the swift development and refinement of a comprehensive set of research skills and provides the opportunity to develop a relationship with a young and rapidly-growing enterprise. We expect all employees to be intellectually curious, ambitious, and interested in assuming increasing levels of responsibility. This is a mid-level research position and candidates with greater experience may be considered for more senior roles which include supervising other researchers. This position will report to both the Quantitative Research Manager and the practice area specific Managing Content Director. About Hanover Hanover Research is a global research and analytics firm that provides high quality, custom research through an annual, fixed-fee model for clients in the corporate, education, and healthcare sectors. Founded in 2003 and headquartered in Arlington, Virginia, Hanover employs high-caliber market researchers, analysts, and account professionals to deliver a robust service infrastructure that is revolutionary in its combination of flexibility and affordability. The core capabilities that drive Hanover’s research engine include primary research, secondary research, data analysis, and grant development. By enthusiastically fostering an environment of respect, encouragement, and support, we empower our clients and employees to seize opportunities for growth, impact, and advancement.  As the second fastest growing market research firm worldwide, Hanover has been recognized as a 2017 American Marketing Association Gold Top 50 Firm and Gold Global Top 50 Firm and a 2015 Washington Business Journal 50 Fastest Growing Company. ResponsibilitiesPerform advanced statistical modeling and regression analysis on education related data;Design and develop customized quantitative research reports on various topics for Education clients;Collaborate with Content Directors on defining project scopes for client deliverables;Analyze complex research requests to provide actionable recommendations and key findings;Compile online sources from relevant databases to support recommendations and insights;Form hypotheses and locate compelling support for arguments under very tight deadlines;Manage tight deadlines to create reports requiring few edits;Train other team members in statistical and quantitative research methodologies;Serve as project lead for Research Associates, assisting with project design and development;Review formatting and data accuracy in key deliverables;Provide guidance and constructive feedback to peer research reports.Desired Skills and AttributesTechnical SkillsAdvanced knowledge of and ability to apply econometric and statistical methods to practical research problems;High comfort level with statistical analysis software, particularly R and Stata. Experience with other programming languages such as Python, with database systems and SQL, or with other analysis tools such as Tableau and ArcGIS is a plus;Experience working with and preparing real-world datasets for analysis, including identifying anomalies and reshaping or merging data;Willingness and ability to pick up new quantitative skills and market research methodologies as necessary and apply them in new contexts;High comfort level with Microsoft Office applications, such as MS Word, MS Excel, and MS Power Point.Other Skills and AttributesStrong command of the English language and demonstrated writing and editing skills, including experience writing or presenting for a business or non-technical professional audience;Demonstrable problem solving skills;Willingness to tackle complex, often unfamiliar research requests;Ability to collaborate and strategize with senior-level research directors;Ability to prioritize and manage multiple short and long-term projects in order to meet deadlines;Ability to work quickly and independently with minimal guidance or oversight;Ability to work under pressure and multitask in a fast-paced environment;Ability to accept feedback and constructive critique positively;Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail;Excellent interpersonal and communication skills;Extremely strong and demonstrable work ethicEducation Requirement A Master’s degree in Statistics, Economics, or a related quantitative discipline. ABD or PhD in a quantitative discipline is preferred. Candidates with advanced degrees in Education or other disciplines with extensive quantitative coursework or professional experience will also be considered. Experience Requirement Minimum of 3 - 5 years of full-time work experience conducting quantitative research and analysis. Experience working in the K-12 or Higher Education sector (for example, in institutional research, assessment, or evaluation) is a plus. Location Arlington, VA BenefitsBase salary401(K) employer matching programComprehensive health and dental benefits packageAdvancement and management opportunitiesCommunity service opportunities If you are interested in the prospect of working for a dynamic, growing company, we encourage you to submit your cover letter, resume, and a relevant professional writing sample (consisting of no more than 8 pages on an education or business related topic preferably) at: http://careers.hanoverresearch.com/current-openings/  Hanover Research is an Equal Opportunity Employer, providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, compensation, training, promotion, transfer, leaves of absence, and termination.

This position within the Incentives team will be the primary person who works in the incentive planning tool used for monthly and yearly spend forecast and spend actualization. Once the person develops an understanding of incentives, the person will make recommendations to improve the incentive planning process and eventual spending programs. Work Flexibility: no travel required Experience: 1 - 2 years of experience, preferably in data-driven, automotive and/or finance-related environment Required Skills: Ability to understand complex data structures and manage those data structures.  Ability to diagnose issues and make recommendations for improvements to data and data structures.  Ability to summarize and explain summaries and issues related to the above data topics.  Curiosity and willingness to explore, learn and understand new systems, data sources and approaches to improve incentives planning. Required Specialized Skills: 1) Experience working with large complex datasets and ideally databases  2) Experience working with team outside of core responsibility team to better understand business operations and how to make efficiency improvements.  3) Experience creating data summaries for presentations Desired Specialized Skills: 1) Experience with Hyperion, Tableau and Excel model creation and maintenance  2) Experience creating presentations and data summaries for audiences outside of direct area of expertise.  3) Experience with data and system mapping and changeovers. Required Education:Bachelor Degree preferably Desired Education: N/A

STR is a privately-owned, rapidly growing business focused on research and development (R&D) for the defense and intelligence communities. STR has approximately 200 employees at sites in Woburn, MA, Dayton, OH and Arlington, VA. We are a nationally recognized leader in research areas including data analytics, sensors and signal processing, electronic warfare, cyber, video and image understanding, command and control, and precision navigation. Several programs have transitioned advanced technology to military and intelligence users. While our primary focus is on serving US Government customers, we are pursuing commercial applications as well.  This position will directly support government customers at their site and will be based out of STR’s Arlington, VA office, while interfacing regularly with colleagues in Woburn, MA. Full-time employees enjoy 401(k), profit sharing, health and welfare benefits, subsidies for training and conference attendance to foster continued learning and development, and a casual yet technically challenging work environment.  STR is dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce where all employees, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, neurodiversity, or other personal characteristics, feel valued, included, and empowered to achieve their best. We recognize that each employee’s backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are essential for providing our customers with innovative solutions to challenging national security problems. STR’s commitment to attracting, retaining, and engaging talented and diverse professionals is demonstrated by our participation, sponsorship, and support in local and national minority organizations. Position Summary:The Senior Solutions Analyst is responsible for working with clients and various CAQH staff to solve problems in a variety of areas across the business of healthcare. Through collaboration and innovation, the Senior Solution Analyst is responsible for the following: •Fulfillment of all tasks inherent in the proposal life-cycle, including proposal creation and maintenance of a response library with new content.•Participating in research and analysis to improve existing solutions and develop new ones that solve real market problems for providers, patients and health plans. This role is full-time, exempt and reports to the Senior Solutions Architect. Specific Responsibilities:•Participate in full RFP / RFI / RFQ / RFX proposal lifecycle from inception through completion. •Support the proposal process. This includes requesting/conducting initial research, review of opportunity and strategic analysis, coordinating proposal schedules and deadlines, developing project plans/timelines, writing all content, and adhering to proposal guidelines and organizational policies.•Maintain a RFP/RFI/RFQ/RFX response library for all CAQH solutions and update as needed. •Analyze proposal documents to determine requirements and develop win strategy.•Evaluate and prepare analysis and feasibility studies related to potential solutions and recommended alternatives.•Participate in analysis of client-identified issues or problems including identification of market place trends, issues, regulatory impact and best practices. •Collaborate with sales teams to understand customer requirements and participate in solution and product demonstrations to existing and potential clients. •Collaborate with Public Affairs team in analyzing Federal and State legislations, regulations and policies to create a solution to the existing product or develop a new product. •Manage multiple tight deadlines and priorities.•Other duties as assigned.Supervisory Responsibility:NoneSkills: •Ability to communicate capabilities and differentiators persuasively and with brevity. •Ability to demonstrate knowledge of the fundamentals of healthcare specifically provider data management, medical claims and coordination of benefits. •Experience analyzing Federal and State legislations, regulations and policies in healthcare. •Demonstrated success developing and improving the proposal response process. •Familiarity with various RFP / RFI / RFQ / RFX formats and processes and methodologies. •Excellent writing and editing skills. •Strong interpersonal skills with ability to multi-task. •Familiarity with software and product development life cycle. •Proficiency in the MS Office Suite (e.g., Word, Excel, Office 365 and PowerPoint)•Ability to work collaboratively and effectively across matrix organizations in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. •Ability to demonstrate time management skills and the ability to prioritize a full plate of work responsibilities. Experience:•Minimum 3 - 5 years’ experience in an analyst role, management consultant or equivalent position. •Minimum 3 years’ experience writing and editing proposals.•Healthcare experience required (with an emphasis on payer or revenue cycle management, operations, finance, claims and coordination of benefits). Education:B.A. or B.S. degree is required; healthcare administration, public health or technology disciplines preferred. WHO WE ARENamed one of Modern Healthcare’s Best Places to Work in 2016, 2017 and 2018 CAQH, a non-profit alliance, is the leader in creating shared initiatives to streamline the business of healthcare. Through collaboration and innovation, CAQH accelerates the transformation of business processes, delivering value to providers, patients and health plans.<U+F0A7>COB Smart® quickly and accurately directs coordination of benefits processes.<U+F0A7>EnrollHub® reduces costly paper checks with enrollment for electronic payments and electronic remittance advice.<U+F0A7>CAQH ProView® eases the burden of provider data collection, maintenance and distribution.<U+F0A7>DirectAssure® increases the accuracy of health plan provider directories.<U+F0A7>VeriFideTM streamlines credentialing by consolidating and standardizing primary source verification.<U+F0A7>SanctionsTrack® delivers comprehensive, multi-state information on healthcare provider licensure disciplinary actions.<U+F0A7>CAQH CORE® maximizes business efficiency and savings by developing and implementing national operating rules.<U+F0A7>CAQH Index® benchmarks progress and helps optimize operations by tracking industry adoption of electronic administrative transactions.WHAT YOU GETCAQH recognizes that its most important asset is its growing team of smart, creative, collaborative, forward-thinking and passionate professionals – and that a comprehensive employee benefits package is an important factor for them in choosing where to work. CAQH offers competitive compensation along with an extensive benefits package for all full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, tuition assistance and a 401k. Our location in downtown Washington, DC is metro-accessible, has an onsite fitness center and is centrally located to allow our team to take advantage of professional networking opportunities, cultural offerings and a thriving social scene.

job_title: National Audit Practice – Lumen Data Analyst – Senior Associate
job_description: Grant Thornton LLP (Grant Thornton) is the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd, one of the world’s leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms. We’ve never been a typical professional services firm. We put people first, and that is what sets us apart.As one of the fastest-growing professional services firms in the world, Grant Thornton LLP is continuously seeking top talent. Discover a place where you’ll work with a team of professionals dedicated to providing bold leadership and distinctive client service. Spend each day engaged in meaningful and challenging work. Be supported in your professional growth and recognized for your contributions.POSITION SUMMARY:National Audit Practice – Lumen Data Analyst – Senior AssociateGrant Thornton, LLP is excited to welcome a Lumen Data Analyst working with engagement teams to deploy Whole Ledger Analytics (WLA), Procure to Pay Analytics and other capabilities on audits. In this role, you will perform the data cleansing and analysis for engagements that require data to be processed in the US. This will give you firsthand knowledge of how our analytics work and how they can best be used as audit evidence. With this knowledge you will become the “go-to person” for questions from our US engagement teams regarding everything from acquisition of data to methodology. In this role you will also be a team member of our “genius bar” troubleshooting issues communicated from our Shared Service Center team of Bangalore Analysts. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: · Provide expert support on data acquisition questions from US teams  · Obtain, ingest, cleanse/validate data, process analytics, review results, and deliver results/coordinate with engagement team  · Collaborate with the Shared Service Center analytics team on Whole Ledger Analytics (WLA) · Anonymize and aggregate benchmarking statistics across engagements processed through WLA  · Assist in rollout of additional analytic toolkits such as employee benefit plan, accounts payable and others as they are developed by the data analytics team · Other duties as assignedQUALIFICATIONS:  · 2-6 years of related work experience in a similar consulting practice or function, servicing cross-industry clients at a national level · Bachelor's degree in Accounting required with additional degrees in Information Technology preferred · CPA License strongly preferred  · Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including an ability to define technical specifications based on audit team meetings on innovation requirements  · Ability to travel on short notice and work additional hours as necessary.  · Travel percentage: under 15 BENEFITS: Grant Thornton LLP promotes a nationally recognized culture of health and offers an extensive array of benefits to meet individual lifestyles. For a complete list of benefits please visit http://www.gt.com/.It is Grant Thornton’s policy to promote equal employment opportunities. All personnel decisions, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, benefits and termination, are made without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

US Citizenship Required and (TS/SCI) RequiredJob Description: Excited about data? Take action with it.  As a Phoenix Data Scientist, you'll be part of a team with access to tons of real mission and that takes action on it. You will not be simply designing algorithms or analyzing theoretical use cases. You'll be using languages like R, Python and Scala to glean actionable insights and build tangible capabilities.  On a typical day as a Phoenix Data Scientist, you'll collaborate with both engineers and mission SMEs (e.g. Cybersecurity or SIGINT analysts) to process mass amounts of data. job_title: Navy Manpower and Personnel Analyst - OPNAV N1
job_description: JOB TITLE: Navy Manpower and Personnel Analyst OPNAV N1 PROJECT OVERVIEW:This position is contingent upon contract award The Deputy Chief of Naval Operations (Manpower, Personnel, Training & Education MPTE) (DCNO, MPTE) (N1) is responsible for the planning, resourcing and execution of manpower and personnel policies and programs in the U.S. Navy. To effectively perform these responsibilities, N1 requires support services in the Commanders Action Group, including MPTE program/policy human resources strategic planning, analysis and justification, program strategic planning and execution, communications and media planning and execution, facilitation of process reviews and analyses, process re-engineering and evaluation of commercial-off-the shelf products in support of human resource initiatives. JOB DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES: The support will require direct liaison with action officers and program managers across the MPTE enterprise as well as all other Navy Enterprises and Enablers to support the employment, development and refinement of MPTE strategic plans, Transformation efforts, Sailor 2025 initiatives and status of manning in the Fleet. Responsibilities include the following: Provide manpower and personnel program and policy analysis support, such as by developing Excel, Access and/or other manpower data spreadsheets used to identify manpower/personnel trends and impactsAssist in the development and implementation of Joint Development and Management Strategic RoadmapsAnalyze and assess the Navys recruiting, manpower, personnel, training and education strategic initiatives, such as support for organizational strategy development including vision, mission, strategic objectives and goalsConduct analysis of strategic initiatives based on effectiveness towards meeting targets and prepare documentation based on analytical and mathematical techniquesProvide strategic management support, such as in sustaining a Managers Internal Control Program (MICP), including process and internal control documentation, testing and corrective actionsSupport POM analysis, such as by developing documentation to include point papers, summary analyses, cost analysis, schedules, and requirementsProvide administrative support, such as facilitating IPTs, special advisory boards, off-sites, working groups, and audit teams, and analyzing and preparing program briefs, reports and correspondenceREQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:Security Clearance:Secret  The position of analyst requires expertise in several professional areas. The analyst must be highly qualified academically as well as professionally specialized and experienced in his/her respective fields with specific experience in military manpower, personnel and strategic planning and policy. SECRET security clearance.Minimum seven years of experience in Data Analysis, Statistical Analysis, Financial Analysis, Marketing, Public Affairs, Complex Problem Solving, Navy POMCapable of performing the tasks in the job description.Bachelors degree in mathematics, statistics, business, law, engineering, social sciences, physical/applied science or management discipline such as business administration, accounting, finance, economics or management information technology.In-depth, working knowledge of existing and evolving strategic plans and activities within Navys MPTE enterprise.Strong communications skills orally and in writing.Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). job_description: JOB TITLE: Enterprise Data Analyst/Program Analyst (Senior) F35 JPO PROJECT OVERVIEW: Project provides support to the F-35 Lightning II Joint Strike Fighter Joint Program Office (JPO) located in Crystal City (Arlington), VA. WHAT YOULL BE DOING Do you have an intense curiosity and interest in in data? Does solving problems and finding new ways to extract data to answer a variety of questions around a positive mission excite you? Then this Data Analyst role may be for you!  Inspire, the largest social network for health, is seeking a highly collaborative professional to work across functional teams and disciplines supporting the dissemination and interpretation of data from across the organization. We work to connect and empower patients and caregivers while finding ways to push forward medical research. In this role, you will be a critical part of a high-profile initiative working to foster stronger networks and engagement within the member community by analyzing dashboards and collaborating with other departments in the organization.  Our new team member will support initiatives in Business Intelligence, Research, and Marketing: Respond to ad-hoc data requests in a clear and consistent mannerAssist in the generation of data visuals across the companyDevelop new reports and dashboardsApply human-centered design principles to the presentation of dataCollaborate with the research team to extract and analyze text data and develop new research questionsCatalog and manage data streams generated by research teamAnalyze marketing opportunities and suggest data-driven approaches to foster user communitiesIdentify and analyze various user segments within and across various user communitiesWHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR You excel in a fast-paced work environment and are excited to push the boundaries of your data skills to answer interesting questions to support. Our new team member will be experienced with most of the items listed below but will also enjoy learning new things and working with a talented group of co-workers to build something truly meaningful. Experience programming with Python, R, Julia, Scala or similar computational languageExperience with flask or other python web frameworkStrong experience with SQL and relational databasesSolid analytical skills and demonstrated problem-solving abilityAn excitement about learning new technologies appropriate to the business needsYou find satisfaction in a job well done and want to solve head-scratching challengesAbility to create PowerPoints/slides to communicate information across the companyYou thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and have the ability to support initiatives with shifting priorities in a fast-moving environmentBachelors degree in a related field with analytical training OR an equivalent combination of education/experience in technology and operationsDesired Characteristics/QualificationsKnowledge of natural language processing, statistics and machine learning techniquesAn understanding of healthcare systems, clinical trials and biomedical researchWHAT WE OFFERA corporate mission that truly makes a differenceFlexible work scheduleTalented, creative co-workers Full time employees are eligible for: Competitive salary and benefitsGenerous Flexible Time Off policy (ask us about it!)Stock optionsHealth insurance, including dental and vision401(k) retirement plan with matchingABOUT INSPIRE Inspire was founded in 2005 out of our interest in health, our personal experiences with difficult health issues, and the vision that we could use the Internet to improve patients' and caregivers’ ability to find support. We believe patient centricity is the future of healthcare.  Inspire’s mission is to bring people together and to accelerate medical research. We have developed focused member groups and partnered with over 100 non-profit patient advocacy organizations, including the American Lung Association, National Osteoporosis Foundation, Arthritis Foundation, National Psoriasis Foundation, and Lupus Foundation of America, to provide online patient communities in a safe, privacy-protected environment. Members are resources for each other sharing health information and support without regard to location, background, or status. Together they reduce the feelings of isolation experienced by those with chronic conditions, cancer, rare diseases. We all believe that “Together we’re better”.  From marketers, designers, to software engineers and healthcare product experts, we are a diverse community with the goal of changing the patient and caregiver experience through community.  Inspire is committed to providing a safe work environment that encompasses mutual respect and equal employment opportunities for all employees. All employment is decided on the basis of merit, job requirements, individual qualifications, and business need. Inspire believes that diversity and inclusion within our team is paramount to our success as an organization devoted to connecting patients and caregivers from a diverse background and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

Optoro is a fast-growing technology company that is revolutionizing the retail industry. Every year, more than 15% of retail goods are returned or simply never sell. This creates tons of unnecessary waste and costs retailers billions. Our mission is to make retail more sustainable by eliminating all waste from returns. Our technology platform connects every returned item to its best home, thereby increasing profitability for retailers, giving consumers great deals, and reducing environmental waste.  Backed by some of the top investors in the country - including Kleiner Perkins, Revolution Growth, and UPS - Optoro is powered by its collaborative, unconventional, and resourceful employees who love solving big problems. We are looking for individuals with similar creativity and energy to help build a lasting company focused on the triple bottom line. Job Scope Optoro's Data Science team is responsible for turning our massive data resources into actionable insights that produce business outcomes. Our team values creativity, willingness to embrace new methods and technology, and the ability to solve problems independently. Interos Solutions, Inc. is a fast-growing supplier of AI and SaaS-delivered solutions to government agencies and the private sector. The core of Interos' solution is the aggregation and analysis of large data sets to identify relationships, patterns, and correlations with the goal of producing predictive and prescriptive insights for our customers to assess, monitor and enhance their business eco-systems. As eco-systems consist of supply chains, partnerships and business alliances, a change in any of these relationships can produce unknown and unexpected business risks.  Are you a top-notch data orintelligence analysis and research professional who wants variety, challenge and the ability to make a difference? We are seeking a Data Analyst for our Insights Team. In this role, you will be researching relationships in business eco-systems and deciphering the meaning and interconnectedness associated with those relationships. Under the direction of a Senior Analyst/Program Manager, you will specifically be responsible for leveraging our AI platform to assemble the puzzle regarding the relationships between businesses, people and products; deciphering the nature of those relationships; and highlighting the impact of those relationships. Company/Position OverviewIn this role you will:The contractor shall develop two types of cybersecurity health reports/scorecards. The contractor shall first work with government employees to define the requirements. Based on the outcome, the first type or scorecard shall be developed to depict the health of an individual system or application. The second type of scorecard shall depict the overall health of the agency’s cybersecurity posture. This shall include a roll-up of the system-level scorecards, plus additional factors as defined. The contractor must provide technically qualified personnel to extract data from various databases and systems in order to generate an automated scorecard system, or recommend Commercial off the Shelf Tools (COTS) tools for the government to procure. Should COTS be leveraged, the contractor shall be responsible for implementation of the tools. The contractor must create scorecards that are visually appealing, functional, and based on industry best practices. RSG is seeking a Research Data Analyst. This position is based in our Arlington, Virginia or White River Junction, Vermont office. AS A RESEARCH DATA ANALYST You are part of a team that applies smartphone-based GPS survey research and analytics with the goal of better understanding behavioral change due to transportation innovation and technology. Your team conducts market research in sectors such as public and private transportation, household travel behavior, future mobility, autonomous vehicles, transportation network companies (TNC), and mobility service providers (MSP). You work on all phases of the market research process including designing and implementing research approaches and survey questionnaires; administering surveys and monitoring data; performing data preparation and database management; conducting analysis; and writing reports and presentations based on findings. You are interested in working on survey datasets in conjunction with different types of datasets such as massive passively-collected location data, commercial marketing data, and publicly available demographic or geospatial data.  You are curious about the future of transportation mobility and its many economic and social implications. You are a strong blend of practical technical skills, research-based analytic skills, and solution-oriented implementation skills. You are a team-player, self-motivated, a clear and concise communicator, and dedicated to high-quality work. You understand that the pace of technology and the resulting insights from data are changing quickly, thus requiring an attitude of flexibility and adaptability. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONSBachelors degree or higher in a relevant field of study such as statistics, math, economics, engineering, geography, market research, data science, or a similar field0-5 years of professional experienceInterest and/or experience in transportation, travel behavior analytics, and survey market researchInterest and/or experience in using Python, R, SQL, PostgreSQL, GitHubOutstanding communication and teaming skills with colleagues and clientsAbility to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of formats (e.g., email, reports, presentations)Ability to prioritize multiple competing objectives and deadlines across projectsBENEFITS100% employee-owned company with Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)Award winning culture and workplace flexibility: http://www.whenworkworks.org/workplace-awards/rsg-2, http://reviews.greatplacetowork.com/rsgCompetitive benefit package Periodic travel is required. Position is based in Arlington, Virginia or White River Junction, Vermont.  RSG is not currently accepting H-1B applicants for this position. EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled.  To Apply: Please visit our employment page: http://rsginc.com/join-us

Additional responsibilities include: Perform data analysis, data matching, statistical analysis, trending activities, and collaborative efforts that result in the detection and prevention of potential fraud, waste, and abuse within and across Medicare and Medicaid. to fulfill law enforcement data requests.Communicates effectively with internal and external customers, including federal law enforcement officers.Validates data analysis results and analytically identifies potential fraud, waste and/or abuse situations in violation of Medicare/Medicaid laws, guidelines, policies, and regulations.Supports management requests for CMS reporting requirements.Utilizes data analysis techniques to detect aberrancies in Medicare/Medicaid claims data and proactively seeks out and develops leads and cases received from a variety of sources including CMS and OIG, fraud alerts, and referrals from government and private sources.Works with Statisticians and Sr. Data Analysts to provide proactive data analysis results with statistically high probabilities of producing case referrals to law enforcement, overpayments, and/or administrative actions.Prepares, develops and participates in provider, beneficiary, law enforcement, or staff training as related to Medicare fraud, waste and/or abuse data analysis.Maintains chain of custody on all documents and follow all confidentiality and security guidelines.Complies with and maintains various documentation and other reporting requirements as needed.Requirements Qualified candidates will possess the following: Bachelor’s degree and/or relevant work experience as a data analyst.Have high proficiency level with MS Access and MS Excel.Requires a working knowledge of SAS and/or other applications to perform various types of data analysis.Knowledge of Medicare and Medicaid rules and regulation is a plusKnowledge of Medicaid Managed Care encounter and claims data is a plusDemonstrated knowledge of various database management systems in order to input, extract or manipulate information.Demonstrated experience and knowledge of health care information (health claims data specifically Medicare and Medicaid, ICD-9-CM codes, physician specialty codes, pharmaceutical data including NCPDP file formats and codes, provider identifiers, etc) is preferred.Preferred experience with Medicare Part C and D data and demonstrated experience and knowledge of pharmaceutical data including NCPDP file formats and codes, and provider identifiers. Enthusiastic individuals who can work effectively in a dynamic environment both in a team as well as independently is a must!  All candidates MUST pass a background check and drug screening prior to employment. Local candidates preferred. Organization Description: Integrity Management Services, Inc. (IntegrityM) is a women owned small business specializing in assisting government healthcare organizations prevent and detect fraud and abuse in their programs. With a highly professional staff of data analysts, statisticians, medical professionals, auditors, investigators, evaluators, and regulatory analysts, IntegrityM focuses on helping ensure the integrity of healthcare program regulations and policy. The Junior Data Analyst will be responsible for the accurate and timely delivery of reports and data requests to various internal and external stakeholders within the HSC Health Care System. The Junior Data Analyst will also be required to develop a broad understanding of data sets available throughout the HSC Health Care System and will be required to create documentation that describes the flow of data from any given data set to its final output format, in accordance with policies set forth for the BI & Analytics area. The Junior Data Analyst will assist with the development, implementation, and maintenance of good and accurate data flowing from user inputs to reporting outputs.Position is responsible for the preparation and analysis of specific reports for the HSC Health Care System. The Junior Data Analyst educates and provides technical support as needed or requested within the scope of specific assigned responsibilities. Supports the Director/Senior Director in all of these endeavors.JOB FUNCTIONSEssential job duties:1.Ability to think strategically in connecting data flows into big picture business outcomes.2.Ability to extract data using a variety of commercially available tools including MS Excel, MS SQL tools, including the ability to learn new analytics tools such as Tableau, Power BI, etc. Ideal fit will be an Excel guru comfortable with advanced data manipulation functions.3.Develops a mastery of all available data sources to effectively serve as an organizational expert on from which databases data can be obtained. Demonstrates a curiosity and drive for identifying the most efficient and accurate reporting solutions.4.Develops and maintains quality control standards and data reconciliation techniques for internal and external reporting.5.Ability to create and maintain documentation relating to data management including training guides, report specifications, and data dictionaries. Requisition Number 18-0041  Post Date 12/7/2018  Title Data Analyst  City Washington  State DC  Description CSSI, is a leading provider of transportation and mobility solution to government and commercial clients, is seeking an Aviation Analyst for an in Washington, DC. The successful candidate will be part of a team supporting the continued evolution, development, and application of multiple of aviation databases in order to benchmark NAS performance, especially in relation to other comparable ATC/ATM systems. In addition, the candidate will help develop and apply analytical tools in order to identify trends and to report those trends to FAA and the airline industry. The successful candidate must be able to work in a team environment with a diverse group of stakeholders. Please Note: Candidates who are Non-Immigrant Aliens (not a U.S. Citizen) or an Immigrant Alien (U.S. Permanent Resident-Green Card Holder) must have resided in the U.S. for a minimum of three (3) years in the last five (5) years. Minimum Qualifications: • Ability to analyze data, recognize errors, diagnose causes, and develop plans for error correction • Experience in database management, ETL procedures, and data/system architectures • Knowledge and skills to develop defensible mathematical models for NAS system performance • Willingness to learn and enthusiasm for solving interesting, impactful, national problems  • Strong written and verbal communications skills and proven ability to work effectively in a diverse and dynamic R&D environment Educational Requirements: • Six (6) years of relevant experience with a Bachelor's Degree; Three (3) years of relevant experience with a Master’s Degree; Zero (0) years of relevant experience with a PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field.  Desired Qualifications: • Experience in the field of aviation and air traffic control operations is desired, particularly from the perspective of data analysis • Strong computing skills, relating to data manipulation, analysis, and master data management • Experience with Python, Java and one or more other high level languages such as C#, C++ • Knowledge and experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau and ArcGIS • Familiarity with FAA flight and trajectory databases such as Aviation System Performance Metrics (ASPM), Traffic Flow Management System (TFMS), Performance Data Analysis and Reporting System (PDARS), National Offload Program (NOP) radar data, Terminal Arrival Efficiency Rate (TAER) • Ability to apply statistical analysis techniques and tools where needed • Familiarity with modeling and simulation tools and methods, including programming experience in Matlab, R, or other modeling tools/languages  • Strong abilities in critical thinking, technical writing, and delivering oral presentation About CSSI:  CSSI, Inc. is a technical and engineering services company headquartered near L’Enfant Plaza in Washington, DC, with additional offices along the Eastern Seaboard. CSSI has been solving challenging problems for the FAA, the DoD and NASA for over 25 years. With nearly 200 employees, CSSI offers challenging work, a comprehensive benefits package, and a collegial environment. CSSI is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnic background, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical impairment, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by law.
