Career Overview JRC Integrated Systems is an award-winning workplace and recognized as one of Greater Washington’s Best Places to Work as well as a Top Work Place in 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017 and 2018. Headquartered in Washington, DC with operations in Alabama, California, Florida, Georgia, Indiana, Massachusetts, New York, and Virginia – JRC is a leading provider of scientific, engineering, management and technical support to the Department of Defense and other federal agencies. Since its inception in 2003, JRC has supported numerous federal initiatives by providing the expertise necessary to provide programmatic support in areas of program management, systems engineering, data analysis, strategic business planning and business operations. Position Description This position will support JRC’s Enterprise Information Management business area supporting the Navy’s Strategic Systems Programs (SSP) and a team of employees in Washington, DC. The candidate will provide knowledge of operations analysis to build business processes for SSP. Currently, the information is located in multiple databases and difficult to find the authoritative version. The project seeks to standardize information creation/capture, create metadata linkages across multiple platforms, and eliminate redundant/conflicting files. The analyst will perform the following: Responsibilities Design, develop, and implement optimal solutions to integrate, store, process and analyze data sets Perform process documentation and value stream mapping improvement analysis Visually display results using Operational Views and Work Flow Processing tools Document existing business rules and proposed rules which would lead to process performance Pre-defines points at which data can be extracted for reporting purposes Coordinates with Architecture, IT teams, Programmer/developer, Program Manager and Project Manager Evaluate and align Business Requirements Documents with Technical Requirements Documents Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent years of experience. Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite of tools. Experience with handling large datasets across multiple database systems Excellent analytical and quantitative skills with strong attention to detail Experience facilitating Joint Application Development (JAD) sessions Strong Knowledge of IT PLC (Project Life Cycle) and Good knowledge of SDLC (Waterfall) Ability to interpret and analyze Business requirements from a Management and IT delivery perspective. Good understanding of IT Swim lanes and Business Capabilities delivery swim lanes. Proof of US citizenship is required. Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearanceJRC Integrated Systems, Inc. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer

Oceanographic Data Specialist/Analyst – Silver Spring, MD  Position 20889468 – Oceanographic Data Specialist/AnalystLynker Technologies has an opening for one Oceanographic Data Specialist/Analyst supporting NOAA.  This work involves the configuration and quality control of station information and metadata for water level, currents, and meteorological stations stored in CO-OPS database. This includes proper entry and verification of configuration settings for data collection platforms, sensor parameters, bench mark information and leveling records. Occasional testing of software improvements may be required. This work also involves loading and quality controlling sensor data and associated metadata for all sensor types in support of all CO-OPS Programs.  The Data Specialist will be responsible for a region of current meter and water level stations where his/her duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to: Enter and verify water level station metadata and data according to established CO-OPS Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for all newly installed or existing water level stations, current meters, and meteorological and oceanographic sensors.Review and assess the quality of bench marks and surveying leveling records and other data submitted from CO-OPS and contractor field parties; enter the information into the database and station packages.Evaluate submitted documentation and data and provide written feedback.Load preliminary water level and current meter data into database.Assist in troubleshooting water level, oceanographic, and meteorological data and metadata issues as they arise.Assist in developing or updating SOPs, manuals, and technical guides, as necessary.Provide technical consultation for supporting NOAA’s Coast Survey hydrographic surveys and National Geodetic Survey remote sensing surveys.Provide oral and written presentations, as necessary.Participate in team meetings and other meetings.Participate in field installations of sensors and in leveling of bench marks to develop a better understanding of CO-OPS observing systems and field procedures.Provide data analysis and produce charts, graphics, and other representations of engineering, oceanographic, and meteorological data.REQUIREMENTS Bachelor of Science degree in oceanography, meteorology, hydrology, physics, physical science, geophysics, engineering, or a closely related discipline is required. Four years of relevant and specialized experience in oceanography, meteorology, physics, physical science, surveying/geodesy, geophysics, or civil engineering technology may be substituted for this education requirement. Position requires some knowledge of oceanography, engineering, meteorology, or physical science, which may have been obtained through related undergraduate coursework or professional experience.Must be proficient in using a desktop computer and MS Office Suite for analyzing and processing data and developing and editing documents. Strong technical writing skills are required.Experience with statistical software is desired.Knowledge of databases, Structured Query Language (SQL), or programming languages are a plus.Ability to work independently and in a team environment is essential.Basic knowledge of engineering drawings is a plus Lynker Technologies, LLC is a growing, HUBZone certified small business specializing in professional, scientific and technical services with offices in Leesburg, VA and Boulder, CO. Our continually expanding team combines scientific expertise with mature, results-driven processes and tools to achieve technically sound, cost effective solutions in geospatial, information technology, hydrology, resource management, conservation, and management and business process improvement.  We focus on putting the right people in the right place to be effective. And having the right people is critical for success. Our streamlined organization enables and empowers our talented professionals to tackle our customers’ scientific and technical priorities – creatively and effectively. Lynker offers a team-oriented work environment, competitive salaries and benefits, and the opportunity to work in a culture of exceptionally skilled and diverse professionals who embrace sound science and creative solutions.  In support of our value of integrity, Lynker promotes a safe and drug free workplace. We participate in E-verify and pre-employment background screening services.  Lynker Technologies is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and veterans to apply.  Please email your resume to clauerman@lynkertech.com to apply.

What do you get when you bring together the brightest minds and place them into an exciting, fast-paced environment that fosters intellectual growth and rewards based on impact, not tenure?  You get one of the fastest growing consulting companies in the United States. While we may be a new name in consultancy, we were born from a storied one. Guidehouse was founded in 2018 as an evolution of PwC Public Sector with a mission to help our clients deliver on their mission; providing bold new strategies that catalyze transformative results across all ends of the enterprise. We embrace brilliance. We embrace independence. Join us.  Guidehouse, LLP helps federal, state, and local governments solve complex business issues, manage risk and add value in financial management, program management, operations improvement, and security and data management. In today's changing environment, the public sector is seeing an increase in physical and cyber threats, financial and performance reporting requirements, diversity in the workforce, and the impact of rapidly changing technologies.  Guidehouse LLP provides management consulting, technology consulting and risk consulting services to help federal and international government agencies anticipate and address these and other complex challenges.  Guidehouse LLP is one of four organizations to receive the 2014 Malcolm Baldrige National Quality Award. The Baldrige Award is the nation’s highest Presidential honor for performance excellence, recognizing U.S. organizations for superior quality and world-class results across six categories defined by Baldrige including Leadership, Strategic Planning, Customer Focus, Measurement, Analysis and Knowledge Management, Workforce Focus, and Operations Focus. For more information on our journey to performance excellence, view our winner profile on the NIST website.  Professionals in Guidehouse LLP may be subject to a government security investigation and may need to meet related eligibility requirements for access to classified information. At least 8 (eight) years of professional experience in quantitative analysis, data management, data quality and report development. Demonstrated ability to conduct quantitative analysis, strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to analyze and interpret data. Experience producing dashboard reports using Power BI, Tableau or similar tool. Experience with relational data bases (Oracle, SQL Server). Experience with a database language such as SQL, SAS, Oracle or Microsoft Access. Ability to create and manage large datasets. Demonstrates ability to work without technical oversight. Solid verbal and written communication skills. Shows initiative, presents ideas to overcome challenges, self-starter. Positive attitude, willingness to learn and apply, team player. Bachelors degree in information systems, database or related fields.

job_title: Data Analyst, Quantitative Research- Education Practice
job_description: Data Analyst, Quantitative Research Education Practice AreaHanover ResearchThe Role The Data Analyst will be responsible for the production of quantitative research reports and strategic briefings on an extremely wide variety of education research topics. This position will allow for the swift development and refinement of a comprehensive set of research skills and provides the opportunity to develop a relationship with a young and rapidly-growing enterprise. We expect all employees to be intellectually curious, ambitious, and interested in assuming increasing levels of responsibility. This is a mid-level research position and candidates with greater experience may be considered for more senior roles which include supervising other researchers. This position will report to both the Quantitative Research Manager and the practice area specific Managing Content Director. About Hanover Hanover Research is a global research and analytics firm that provides high quality, custom research through an annual, fixed-fee model for clients in the corporate, education, and healthcare sectors. Founded in 2003 and headquartered in Arlington, Virginia, Hanover employs high-caliber market researchers, analysts, and account professionals to deliver a robust service infrastructure that is revolutionary in its combination of flexibility and affordability. The core capabilities that drive Hanovers research engine include primary research, secondary research, data analysis, and grant development. By enthusiastically fostering an environment of respect, encouragement, and support, we empower our clients and employees to seize opportunities for growth, impact, and advancement.  As the second fastest growing market research firm worldwide, Hanover has been recognized as a 2017 American Marketing Association Gold Top 50 Firm and Gold Global Top 50 Firm and a 2015 Washington Business Journal 50 Fastest Growing Company. ResponsibilitiesPerform advanced statistical modeling and regression analysis on education related data;Design and develop customized quantitative research reports on various topics for Education clients;Collaborate with Content Directors on defining project scopes for client deliverables;Analyze complex research requests to provide actionable recommendations and key findings;Compile online sources from relevant databases to support recommendations and insights;Form hypotheses and locate compelling support for arguments under very tight deadlines;Manage tight deadlines to create reports requiring few edits;Train other team members in statistical and quantitative research methodologies;Serve as project lead for Research Associates, assisting with project design and development;Review formatting and data accuracy in key deliverables;Provide guidance and constructive feedback to peer research reports.Desired Skills and AttributesTechnical SkillsAdvanced knowledge of and ability to apply econometric and statistical methods to practical research problems;High comfort level with statistical analysis software, particularly R and Stata. Experience with other programming languages such as Python, with database systems and SQL, or with other analysis tools such as Tableau and ArcGIS is a plus;Experience working with and preparing real-world datasets for analysis, including identifying anomalies and reshaping or merging data;Willingness and ability to pick up new quantitative skills and market research methodologies as necessary and apply them in new contexts;High comfort level with Microsoft Office applications, such as MS Word, MS Excel, and MS Power Point.Other Skills and AttributesStrong command of the English language and demonstrated writing and editing skills, including experience writing or presenting for a business or non-technical professional audience;Demonstrable problem solving skills;Willingness to tackle complex, often unfamiliar research requests;Ability to collaborate and strategize with senior-level research directors;Ability to prioritize and manage multiple short and long-term projects in order to meet deadlines;Ability to work quickly and independently with minimal guidance or oversight;Ability to work under pressure and multitask in a fast-paced environment;Ability to accept feedback and constructive critique positively;Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail;Excellent interpersonal and communication skills;Extremely strong and demonstrable work ethicEducation Requirement A Masters degree in Statistics, Economics, or a related quantitative discipline. ABD or PhD in a quantitative discipline is preferred. Candidates with advanced degrees in Education or other disciplines with extensive quantitative coursework or professional experience will also be considered. Experience Requirement Minimum of 3 - 5 years of full-time work experience conducting quantitative research and analysis. Experience working in the K-12 or Higher Education sector (for example, in institutional research, assessment, or evaluation) is a plus. Location Arlington, VA BenefitsBase salary401(K) employer matching programComprehensive health and dental benefits packageAdvancement and management opportunitiesCommunity service opportunities If you are interested in the prospect of working for a dynamic, growing company, we encourage you to submit your cover letter, resume, and a relevant professional writing sample (consisting of no more than 8 pages on an education or business related topic preferably) at: http://careers.hanoverresearch.com/current-openings/  Hanover Research is an Equal Opportunity Employer, providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, compensation, training, promotion, transfer, leaves of absence, and termination.

job_title: Scientific Program Analyst - Biomedical Data - NIH
job_description: Scientific Program Analyst – Biomedical Data *** NIH *** Bethesda, MD  Kelly Government Solutions is a strategic supplier and business partner to the federal government and its key suppliers. Through our partnership with the National Institutes of Health, Kelly Government Solutions offers administrative, IT, engineering, scientific, and healthcare professionals the opportunity to work with one of the most prestigious research organizations in the world. We are currently seeking a Scientific Program Analyst – Biomedical Data to work with the National Institutes of Health in Bethesda, MD.  This is a long-term contract position which offers: Competitive salary with comprehensive benefit packageOpportunity to work at NIH, world's foremost medical research centerLearn more about what Kelly can do for you at www.kellygovernmentsolutions.com TASKS/SERVICES: The contractor shall: (1) Coordinate and schedule meetings for the Biomedical Data Translator (Translator for short) program; provide program support and technical expertise.  (2) Schedule, organize and coordinate logistics for meetings; arrange room and audiovisual reservations; coordinate with participants; prepare announcements, agendas and materials for presentation.  (3) Take, summarize and distribute minutes from meetings; track action items; maintain spreadsheets of relevant information.  (4) Perform grant searches; track and update award status in electronic databases; track Funding Opportunity Announcements (FOA) status when FOAs are under development.  (5) Develop, update and maintain information databases.  (6) Work with staff on project management; track progress toward project milestones, including importance of each task and dependencies between tasks; communicate progress and expectations to the project team and stakeholders for both scientific research aspects of the project as well as software release management.  (7) Collect, analyze and interpret data; prepare reports and summaries.  (8) Locate scientific, program and related information on the internet and other means, including literature, web and database searches; conduct searches for material for specific programmatic needs; prepare literature reviews and summaries.  (9) Prepare presentations, spreadsheets, charts and graphs to communicate information.  (10) Work with NCATS Office of Communication to ensure that information on Translator is up to date on the website; make sure that information is disseminated.  (11) Oversee planning and organization of quarterly face-to-face PI meetings.  (12) Gather information for documentation of project software. REQUIREMENTS: The contractor ideally would have:  (1) Master’s degree in Biology, Biochemistry, Genetics or a related discipline; two (2) years of specialized experience plus a Bachelor’s degree is equivalent to a Master’s degree.  (2) Minimum of three (3) years of experience in biology or a related field.  (3) Knowledge of NIH grant system.  (4) Expertise with Microsoft Office Suite (MS Word, Excel, Outlook PowerPoint).  (5) Strong communications skills, both oral and written.  (6) Excellent analytical, organizational and time management skills. PLEASE APPLY ONLINE Note that the phone number for our NIH branch is not listed. Due to the high volume of inquiries, we regret that we cannot accept phone calls. All qualified candidates will be contacted.About  Kelly Services® As a workforce advocate for over 70 years, we are proud to have a role in managing employment opportunities for more than one million workers around the globe. We employ 550,000 of these individuals directly with the remaining workers engaged through our talent supply chain network of supplier partners. Revenue in 2015 was $5.5 billion. Visit kellyservices.com and connect with us on Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter.Kelly Services is an equal opportunity employer including, but not limited to, Minorities, Females, Individuals with Disabilities, Protected Veterans, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity and is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Equal Employment Opportunity is The Law.

Our high-caliber employees are rewarded in many waysnot only through competitive salaries and benefits packages, but the opportunity to create a meaningful impact in jobs and on projects that matter.  Perspectas talented and robust workforce14,000 strongstands ready to welcome you to the team. Lets make an impact together.  Perspecta is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categoriesResponsibilitiesAir Force Business - Capabilities Lifecycle Management (B-CLM) Projects supports Office of the Deputy Under Secretary of the Air Force, Management and Deputy Chief Management Office (SAF/MG) in developing more effective and efficient ways to support Air Force business operations and refine the development of Defense Business System (DBS) requirements supporting the Business Mission Area (BMA) Information Technology (IT). This position will support SAF/MG's business mission transformation efforts seeking to make the USAFs organize, train, and equip responsibilities more effective for our warfighter through the development and adoption of more efficient business/mission practices and performance measures. Additionally SAF/MG is responsible for guiding the Air Force to reduce overall cost of operations consistent with direction from the Office of the Secretary of Defense and the Office of Management and Budget.  The depth of support required for an individual project can range across a collection of skills (from Master Black Belt to data capture experts) and span varied timeframes (weeks to months) for individually chartered projects. Projects will often involve defining information requirements and information technology requirements to acquire enabling capabilities. Work performed under this contract may have associated specialty government or contract support skills assisting in a project, with expectation of complementary action and effective teaming to successfully improve processes and performance within Air Force core mission areas.  The Black Belt is a recognized authority across multiple areas of expertise. Provide leadership at a high technical and programmatic level for teams to accomplish customer sponsored projects, including new program development. Leadership comprises problem definition, identification of avenues of approach, identification of applicable resources, and execution of tasks within the project. Black Belt facilitators will be capable of mentorship and facilitation of moderate to highly complex problem-solving using diverse methods and tools with a focus on achieving needed customer outcomes. Works with Functional SMEs to understand business processes. Capable to evaluate the current state and identify the areas of improvement. Participates in workshops and captures Business Process Activities, Business Rules, Information Assets, IT Functional Requirements and Transformation Actions. Collaborates with SMEs to sanitize and finalize requirements. Documents requirements in the form of Scenarios and Use Cases. Enters and conducts analysis activities on requirements. Identify Measures of Effectiveness and Measures of Performance for Business Process Activities. Schedule meetings, workshops and facilitates collaboration between different Functionals. Manages review and approval of deliverables.  Specific responsibilities: Conduct process improvement facilitation using structured problem solving methods (from continual process improvement to major business process re-engineering)Utilize advanced methods of developing and managing enterprise level and enterprise-wide organizational strategic alignment and deploymentDrive organizational change managementPerform project managementPerform process modeling and related data captureQualificationsBlack Belt (BB) certification with experience in continual improvement methods to facilitate and mentor major initiatives. Methods to be used span Lean Six Sigma, Business Process Re-engineering, Theory of Constraints, and/or other Structure Problem Solving methodologies. Must have experience chartering projects, working with Champion/Sponsor to define scope & deliverables, and lead teams using DMAIC, DMADV, and other approaches as appropriate. Candidate is required to have experience in MS Visio, iGraphx, or other process modeling tools to document current and future state processes and possess a minimum of two years of process improvement facilitation experience.  The selected candidate will also have experience in developing effective performance metrics and measurements, to align with strategic priorities and performance standards, to include governance methods to assure performance objectives are met. Project and/or program management experience is required.PMI PMP certification is desired. Knowledge or experience with Air Force Services Development and Delivery Process (SDDP)/BCAC and various Change Management techniques is a plus.  Relevant experience, including supervisory, project management experience, and facilitation expertise leading/working requirement definition for Information Technology projects. Candidate must have a minimum of 5 years experience with a Bachelor's degree or 3 years of experience with a Master's degree. The Business Analyst 4 requires a Master Black Belt certification and over five years of industry experience transforming large international corporations in the application of lean principles, methodologies, and tools including modernization of supporting business systems. Senior Data Analyst  Senior Data Analyst position with Capital One Services, LLC in McLean, VA; Multiple positions available:  -Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis of econometric data, relating constants and variables, restrictions, alternatives, conflicting objectives, and their numerical parameters.  -Define data requirements and gather and validate information, applying judgment and statistical tests.  -Develop data structures to support the generation of business insights and strategy.  -Maintain data infrastructure and develop scripts for regular processes.  -Design and develop operational data analysis and visualization tools, techniques, metrics, and dashboards to meet business needs.  -Analyze data analysis requests obtained from management to determine operational problems and define data modeling requirements, validation of content, and problem solving parameters.  -Identify opportunities to use data to develop new strategies and improve business performance and utilize knowledge of mathematical modeling and other optimization methods to perform quantitative and qualitative data analysis.  -Communicate and present data to management by developing reports using Tableau or Business Intelligence tools. Req ID 102878BR Business Title Operations Research Analyst, Sr Principal Group MSS Location USA DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA Washington Clearance Level Needed Top Secret Category Scientific / Analytical Job Duties and Responsibilities Conducts complex logical analysis of management problems and management information requirements and formulates mathematical models of problems for solutions by computer. Gathers, relates, identifies data with variables in models by applying personal judgment and mathematical tests. May supervise more junior staff and schedule work to meet completion dates. Interfaces with customer and helps define work process. Req ID 102856BR Business Title Warfare Analyst, Senior Group MSS Location USA DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA Washington Clearance Level Needed Top Secret Category Scientific / Analytical Job Duties and ResponsibilitiesManTech is actively seeking talented professionals eager to “secure the future” supporting mission critical programs and solving some of the toughest problems critical to our great Nation's security. We are looking for experienced BRAWLER, CFAM, or AFSIM Analysts to support our dynamic, growing program in Arlington, VA.  To be considered, one must currently hold a current / active SECRET clearance (Top SECRET highly preferred) Project overview:Provide analytical support utilizing modeling and simulation tools to create and maintain the data structures to provide short notice, responsive analysis capability in addition to long-term studies.Use modeling and simulation expertise to support study plan objectives, construct scenarios, create and maintain input data structures and files, run/modify the models, analyze model output, prepare output for presentation, and assist in final documentation of HQ AF/A9 analytical efforts. These efforts include various support analyses, weapon system capability analyses, current and future force structure analyses, munitions analyses, and future trade-off studies such as Analyses of Alternatives (AoAs).Models include but are not limited to the Combat Forces Assessment Model (CFAM), BRAWLER (Air Combat Simulation), Advanced Framework for Simulation, Integration, and Modeling (AFSIM), Synthetic Theater Operations Research Model (STORM), Weapons Effects Analysis and Probability Software (WEAPS), and the Joint Munitions Effectiveness Manual (JMEM) Weaponeering System (JWS).Job Description Responsibilities: Deliver analysis products associated with modeling and simulation tools and create and maintain the data structures used by them to provide short notice, responsive analysis capability in addition to long-term studies. Experience in modeling & simulation and analysis of modern combat aircraft and other airborne systems and weapons employment in an air campaign or other theater-wide operational environment.  Assist the government in performing force structure and munitions analyses. They will examine specific questions that relate to force structure composition, modernization, or recapitalization. These studies may include broad forces across multiple mission design series or specifically focus on a single weapon system. Alternatively, these studies may examine war reserve materiel including munitions inventory requirements, modernization of existing munitions, or new munitions. These studies will use CFAM, BRAWLER, AFSIM, STORM, WEAPS, JWS, or other analytic models or tools. These studies may be long-term efforts lasting months or short notice efforts requiring results in days. job_title: Navy Manpower and Personnel Analyst - OPNAV N1
job_description: JOB TITLE: Navy Manpower and Personnel Analyst OPNAV N1 PROJECT OVERVIEW:This position is contingent upon contract award The Deputy Chief of Naval Operations (Manpower, Personnel, Training & Education MPTE) (DCNO, MPTE) (N1) is responsible for the planning, resourcing and execution of manpower and personnel policies and programs in the U.S. Navy. To effectively perform these responsibilities, N1 requires support services in the Commanders Action Group, including MPTE program/policy human resources strategic planning, analysis and justification, program strategic planning and execution, communications and media planning and execution, facilitation of process reviews and analyses, process re-engineering and evaluation of commercial-off-the shelf products in support of human resource initiatives. JOB DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES: The support will require direct liaison with action officers and program managers across the MPTE enterprise as well as all other Navy Enterprises and Enablers to support the employment, development and refinement of MPTE strategic plans, Transformation efforts, Sailor 2025 initiatives and status of manning in the Fleet. Responsibilities include the following: Provide manpower and personnel program and policy analysis support, such as by developing Excel, Access and/or other manpower data spreadsheets used to identify manpower/personnel trends and impactsAssist in the development and implementation of Joint Development and Management Strategic RoadmapsAnalyze and assess the Navys recruiting, manpower, personnel, training and education strategic initiatives, such as support for organizational strategy development including vision, mission, strategic objectives and goalsConduct analysis of strategic initiatives based on effectiveness towards meeting targets and prepare documentation based on analytical and mathematical techniquesProvide strategic management support, such as in sustaining a Managers Internal Control Program (MICP), including process and internal control documentation, testing and corrective actionsSupport POM analysis, such as by developing documentation to include point papers, summary analyses, cost analysis, schedules, and requirementsProvide administrative support, such as facilitating IPTs, special advisory boards, off-sites, working groups, and audit teams, and analyzing and preparing program briefs, reports and correspondenceREQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:Security Clearance:Secret  The position of analyst requires expertise in several professional areas. The analyst must be highly qualified academically as well as professionally specialized and experienced in his/her respective fields with specific experience in military manpower, personnel and strategic planning and policy. SECRET security clearance.Minimum seven years of experience in Data Analysis, Statistical Analysis, Financial Analysis, Marketing, Public Affairs, Complex Problem Solving, Navy POMCapable of performing the tasks in the job description.Bachelors degree in mathematics, statistics, business, law, engineering, social sciences, physical/applied science or management discipline such as business administration, accounting, finance, economics or management information technology.In-depth, working knowledge of existing and evolving strategic plans and activities within Navys MPTE enterprise.Strong communications skills orally and in writing.Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). DESIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:Experience as analyst supporting OPNAV N1 and/or the Commanders Action Group.Experience analyze military service recruiting and retention.WORK LOCATION: Arlington, VA TRAVEL: None KEY WORDS: Plans of action and milestones (POAMs), critical path analysis, integrated master plans, integrated master schedules, manpower, Joint Development and Management Strategic Roadmaps, Continuous Performance Improvement (CPI) methodology, Navy Recruiting and Retention, Managers Internal Control Program (MICP), program objective memorandum (POM) WBB is a technical and management consulting company that provides innovative products and services that solve government and commercial customers toughest problems. For more than 30 years, WBB has set the standard for excellence in consulting services, while providing its employees with an outstanding work environment with ample opportunities for growth and success. WBB continues to enjoy impressive growth, which is directly attributed to the companys hiring practice of always hiring the very best professionals from government, military and industry.We are proud of our diverse environment and are an Equal Opportunity Employer. WBB is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. WBB participates in E-Verify.WBB does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of WBB and WBB will not be obligated to pay a placement fee.

Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services    NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.     NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Chief Data Scientist Location  Washington, DC # of openings 1Apply Now Job SummaryChief Data ScientistSUMMARY The Chief Data Scientist is responsible for the advancement of the MSRB’s data strategy, specifically in the areas of data management, governance, and analytics. The successful candidate will be able to collect, analyze and interpret large data sets and to develop data-driven insights and solutions that will support market transparency and market regulation initiatives and improve business outcomes. This position will also drive the assessment of the quality, validity, usefulness and dependencies of all the MSRB data systems and ensure appropriate data management and data governance principles. The ideal candidate will exhibit a passion for data and work effectively with stakeholders to enhance the MSRB’s role as the sole repository of municipal securities market data. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESProvides the vision and strategy for data usage, working with stakeholders to leverage data, technology, and process to support the strategic plan of the organization. Turn raw data into new insights, recommendations, and reports that will support business decisionsUnderstand what data is available internally and externally, source data to fill capability gaps, and develop and action plan on how it will drive business decisions including: Understand, describe, rationalize, classify and organize all current MSRB data.Develop and maintain data lineage, data catalog, metadata architecture and data taxonomy and glossaryWork with IT to develop the roadmap for master data management, data warehouse and reportingDevelop and continuously enhance a strategy for collecting, storing, accessing, archiving and controlling data, including third-party dependenciesPerform cost/benefit analysis of alternative methodologies and vendors and make recommendations to senior managementFoster the use of data on any potential rulemaking as well as other business initiatives that could be served by data analysisProvide expertise and advise on all major data-related or data-intensive initiativesCreate, maintain and update policies and procedures for data management, governance and analyticsEstablish standards and protocols for effective data quality management across the enterpriseBe a change leader for the organization in building effective data management practices throughout the organizationProvide enterprise-wide strategy and adoption of data management services and its alignment with organization wide objectives for data acquisition, integration, analytics, warehousing and storagePartner with key business stakeholders across the organization to define organizational data and analytic strategyManages a formal data quality program to include the development of internal controls, reporting metrics and analysis based on industry best practices (e.g., DAMA)EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS Education/Experience: The ideal candidate has driven the data strategy within a data-centric organization and has 10+ years of working experience in a data management role. Candidate has direct supervisory experience managing high performing teams. Candidate has experience using statistical computer languages and database querying (R, Python, SLQ, etc.); web services (Redshift, S3, Spark, etc.); distributed data/computing tools (Hadoop, Hive, Map/Reduce, etc.); and artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms and statistics. An MBA or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field is preferred. Financial services regulatory experience and knowledge of municipal securities industry is desired.  The right candidate must have a proven and successful experience leading multi-disciplinary teams across organizations. This candidate will have an ability to understand and relay complex data-related issues in an easy to understand manner and will also demonstrate expertise in big data technology infrastructure and environments coupled with business process architecture. This candidate will also be highly familiar with a variety of industry concepts, best practices and protocols. Interpersonal Skills: the right candidate will also be a result-driven individual, be highly creative and analytical, be a strategic thinker, have an ability to work comfortably in a collaborative setting, and be comfortable working with business top-leadership and executives, including making presentations to the MSRB’s Board of Directors if requested. The right candidate will have exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills with an ability to extract and translate meaningful information.

Oceanographic Data Specialist/Analyst – Silver Spring, MD  Position 20889468 – Oceanographic Data Specialist/AnalystLynker Technologies has an opening for one Oceanographic Data Specialist/Analyst supporting NOAA.  This work involves the configuration and quality control of station information and metadata for water level, currents, and meteorological stations stored in CO-OPS database. This includes proper entry and verification of configuration settings for data collection platforms, sensor parameters, bench mark information and leveling records. Occasional testing of software improvements may be required. This work also involves loading and quality controlling sensor data and associated metadata for all sensor types in support of all CO-OPS Programs.  The Data Specialist will be responsible for a region of current meter and water level stations where his/her duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to: Enter and verify water level station metadata and data according to established CO-OPS Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for all newly installed or existing water level stations, current meters, and meteorological and oceanographic sensors.Review and assess the quality of bench marks and surveying leveling records and other data submitted from CO-OPS and contractor field parties; enter the information into the database and station packages.Evaluate submitted documentation and data and provide written feedback.Load preliminary water level and current meter data into database.Assist in troubleshooting water level, oceanographic, and meteorological data and metadata issues as they arise.Assist in developing or updating SOPs, manuals, and technical guides, as necessary.Provide technical consultation for supporting NOAA’s Coast Survey hydrographic surveys and National Geodetic Survey remote sensing surveys.Provide oral and written presentations, as necessary.Participate in team meetings and other meetings.Participate in field installations of sensors and in leveling of bench marks to develop a better understanding of CO-OPS observing systems and field procedures.Provide data analysis and produce charts, graphics, and other representations of engineering, oceanographic, and meteorological data.REQUIREMENTS Bachelor of Science degree in oceanography, meteorology, hydrology, physics, physical science, geophysics, engineering, or a closely related discipline is required. Four years of relevant and specialized experience in oceanography, meteorology, physics, physical science, surveying/geodesy, geophysics, or civil engineering technology may be substituted for this education requirement. Position requires some knowledge of oceanography, engineering, meteorology, or physical science, which may have been obtained through related undergraduate coursework or professional experience.Must be proficient in using a desktop computer and MS Office Suite for analyzing and processing data and developing and editing documents. Strong technical writing skills are required.Experience with statistical software is desired.Knowledge of databases, Structured Query Language (SQL), or programming languages are a plus.Ability to work independently and in a team environment is essential.Basic knowledge of engineering drawings is a plus Lynker Technologies, LLC is a growing, HUBZone certified small business specializing in professional, scientific and technical services with offices in Leesburg, VA and Boulder, CO. Our continually expanding team combines scientific expertise with mature, results-driven processes and tools to achieve technically sound, cost effective solutions in geospatial, information technology, hydrology, resource management, conservation, and management and business process improvement.  We focus on putting the right people in the right place to be effective. And having the right people is critical for success. Our streamlined organization enables and empowers our talented professionals to tackle our customers’ scientific and technical priorities – creatively and effectively. Lynker offers a team-oriented work environment, competitive salaries and benefits, and the opportunity to work in a culture of exceptionally skilled and diverse professionals who embrace sound science and creative solutions.  In support of our value of integrity, Lynker promotes a safe and drug free workplace. We participate in E-verify and pre-employment background screening services.  Lynker Technologies is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and veterans to apply.  Please email your resume to clauerman@lynkertech.com to apply.

job_title: Navy Program Analyst Program Integration Support OPNAV N2N6
job_description: JOB TITLE: Navy Program Analyst Program Integration Support OPNAV N2N6 PROJECT OVERVIEW: The US Navy headquarters staff at the Pentagon, known as OPNAV, supports the Chief of Naval Operations in his mission to support the warfighter by setting requirements, budgeting resources, and managing programs for many different Navy programs.  This position supports the Portfolio Management Branch (N2N6FP1) which provides oversight over Joint processes, supports liaison with the U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) and U.S. Marine Corps (USMC), manages C4I capabilities and modernization plans, and oversees executive preparation tasks that affect the Navys portfolio of Information Warfare programs. JOB DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Program Integration reviews processes and monitors the execution of budgeted dollars against the execution of approved resources; provides analysis as well as reports and data. Program Integration accomplishes this through use of tools including but not limited to: Internet Resource Allocation Planning System (iRAPS) and Program Budget Information System (PBIS). The services are for strategic and operational level support for liaison with commands, activities, units, and organizations, to include but not limited to the Combatant Commands, Services, Department of Defense Agencies, and/or international agencies. Specific tasks include: Assist N2N6 with coordination of internal N2N6F policy, integration, planning, programming and budgeting of OPNAV programs.Participate in providing reports on the impact of DoD and DoN directed budget actions on Navy C4I capabilities and plans and make recommendations.Assist N2N6 with monitoring budget execution and POM planning status across all programs under N2N6F resource sponsorship and assist N2N6 with recommendations on POM issues, execution year funding, below threshold reprogramming, and above-threshold reprogramming.Assist N2N6 with providing Information Warfare technical support to Navy resource and requirements sponsors in the development of Information Warfare requirements for Navy shore installations.Assist N2N6 with reviewing platform requirements documents, draft comments, and recommended additions, deletions, or changes to proposed documents.Assist N2N6 in coordination activities with Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD), Joint, Navy, USMC and other Service staffs, and other relevant external organizations for the integration of program technical, cost, schedule, and budget information as required during the Navys PPBE cycle.Assist N2N6 with the coordination of executive preparation for information briefs and decision briefs that require N2N6 senior leadership participation.REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:Security Clearance:Secret Active Secret ClearanceAbility to interface with senior military officers and Government civilians to provide professional, informed reports on the status of work.7 years of progressive experience (at least three years of which were in a managerial capacity) in capability definition and operation of IT, space systems, Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (C4ISR) systems and/or unmanned systems. Knowledge of Capital Planning and Investment Control; development of Enterprise Architectures, Standards, Governance, Policy; Information Assurance/Security; the Department of Defense Planning, Programming, Budgeting, and Execution (PPBE) Process; and Naval concepts is highly desired.Proficient in MS Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel.Ability to manage diverse taskings.Familiarity with DoD requirements and budgeting processes.DESIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:Experience working at OPNAV, or other Echelon 1 or 2 staffs.Experience in headquarters facilities isses (MILCON, manning, C2 systems).PPBE/POM experience.WORK LOCATION: Arlington, VA TRAVEL: Less than 5% WBB is a technical and management consulting company that provides innovative products and services that solve government and commercial customers toughest problems. For more than 30 years, WBB has set the standard for excellence in consulting services, while providing its employees with an outstanding work environment with ample opportunities for growth and success. WBB continues to enjoy impressive growth, which is directly attributed to the companys hiring practice of always hiring the very best professionals from government, military and industry.We are proud of our diverse environment and are an Equal Opportunity Employer. WBB is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. WBB participates in E-Verify.WBB does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of WBB and WBB will not be obligated to pay a placement fee.

job_title: Financial Management Senior Analyst OPNAV N1
job_description: JOB TITLE: N1 MPTE Financial Management Senior Analyst OPNAV N1 PROJECT OVERVIEW:This position is contingent upon contract award The Deputy Chief of Naval Operations (Manpower, Personnel, Training & Education MPTE) (DCNO, MPTE) (N1) is responsible for the planning, resourcing, and execution of manpower and personnel policies and programs in the U.S. Navy. To effectively perform these responsibilities, N1 requires professional, technical and/or administrative support services in the area of Financial Management. The scope of this effort, including on-site support, shall encompass preparation, analysis of financial statements and documentation associated with all facets of government accounting and management. JOB DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES: The support shall require direct liaison with action officers and program managers across the MPTE enterprise as well as all other Navy Enterprises and Enablers to support the financial management requirements of OPNAV N1 and its subordinate commands. The senior analyst shall provide the following professional, technical, or administrative services in support of financial management for OPNAV N1 and BUPERS PERS7: Review and prepare draft Program Objective Memorandum (POM) documentation.Develop Impact Statements and review future year financial program plans.Develop financial aspects of POA&Ms.Provide program analysis and evaluation reports in support of the Navy programming and budget process.Conduct financial analysis and financial risk analysis, identifying and evaluating financial risks and recommend management techniques to mitigate risk exposure.Coordinate, advise and draft budget formulation documentation and recommendations in support of the Navy, OSD and Congressional program and Budget processes.Prepare ledger reports, ledger tracking, maintenance and support of specified financial management information systems, the Standard Accounting, Budgeting and Reporting System (SABRS), and Standard Accounting Reporting System (STARS) or any other official accounting program tracking systems.Collect, monitor and analyze obligation/expenditure information from the source (contractor or government activity) and official and/or unofficial accounting records or systems.Draft/review/prepare back up information and recommendations for financial presentations.Resolve problem disbursements.Provide reconciliation for the unofficial undistributed disbursements (UUDs) and negative un-liquidated obligations with SABRS, STARS and/or other accounting systems.Track and provide recommendations for execution of the Navy financial systems such as the Navy Industrial Accounting and budgeting systems.Provide senior, on-site financial management analysis support for the Navy Subsistence-in-Kind (SIK) program (N704).Identify and resolve execution, disbursements and reimbursement issues.Provide information and recommendations to respond to Congressional, DOD, other Government agency, media or industry inquiries, and audits and for Congressional testimony.Provide administrative support, such as facilitating IPTs, special advisory boards, off-sites, working groups, audit teams, etc.REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:Security Clearance:Secret  The position of senior analyst requires expertise in several professional areas. The analyst must be highly qualified academically as well as professionally specialized and experienced in his/her respective fields with specific experience in government financial accounting and management. Req ID 102785BR  Business Title Workforce Development Analyst  Group MCIS  Location USA DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA Washington  Clearance Level Needed Public Trust  Category Administrative Services  Job Duties and Responsibilities As the complexity of the IT security-focused threats grows, so too does the need to enhance the skills of this entity's workforce. This individual shall work with the government to identify the skills needed to maintain and enhance this organization's security posture, identify gaps between those skills and the existing workforce, and put in place processes, strategies and programs for enhancing those skill-sets. This Workforce Development Analyst will work in close coordination with key stakeholders, such as training developers and human resource personnel to support the overarching Workforce Development effort. Additionally, these efforts must be informed by best practices from the public and private sectors and align with guiding federal requirements and legislation. The contractor shall support the following: Assist in the development and implementation of a Department-wide cyber security workforce development strategic implementation plan to include the targeted areas of recruitment and staff planning, career development and training, and talent and performance management.Research, develop, and implement recruiting best practices for IT and Cyber security needs. Support implementation of a multi-tier targeted recruitment plan for high-touch, medium-touch, and low touch outreach to Centers of Academic Excellence (CAEs)Support recruiting branding efforts and assist in change management effortsHelp develop and update career paths for critical IT and cyber security roles including research, meeting facilitation, and final documentation.Provide support for the update and/or development of workforce policies, memoranda, and guidance.Assist in the coordination of Department-wide workforce planning-focused activities.Assist in the collection and aggregation of data necessary to support internal and external workforce-focused data calls and activities.Provide administrative and logistical support for meetings and monthly workforce development-focused working group as needed.Individual will have the ability to make a difference at an enterprise level.Qualifications and Education/Certification RequirementsB.A. or B.S.in related field and four to six years of experience in information assurance services and/or a human resource discipline, such as workforce development, talent management, learning and development, or organizational development. B.A. or B.S. may be substituted with 4 years of experience in a related field.Experience with cyber security training, education programs, and/or recruiting. Experience establishing and/or maintaining a department-level workforce development plan, experience with workforce development, to include, but not limited to: developing position descriptions, developing competency models, developing career paths for various cyber security professional roles, and with delivering, and tracking training at the enterprise level.Work in concert with multiple key program stakeholders to ensure that high-quality workforce development deliverables are produced on-time, properly reflect the tone and culture of the organization, and are appropriate to the audience.Strong experience with Office of Personnel Management (OPM) competency models in cyber security and proficiency levels as well as the National Initiative for Cybersecurity Education (NICE) framework. Familiarity with OPM's Multipurpose Occupational Systems Analysis Inventory - Close-Ended (MOSAIC) methodology helpful.Strong verbal and written communication skills, and attention to detail are a must. It is highly desirable that candidates possess strong interpersonal skills. Qualifications B.A. or B.S.in related field and four to six years of experience or equivalent work experience in lieu of a degree  Degrees See Qualifications  Years of Experience See Qualifications  Position Type Full-Time  Shift Day  Overview ManTech International Corporation is comprised of approximately 7,300 talented employees who use advanced technology to help government and industry meet some of their greatest challenges around the world. We adhere to the simple, no-nonsense values on which ManTech was founded more than four decades ago, aligning squarely with the mission objectives of our customers. As our customer base continues to expand and diversify, we continue to diversify our workforce and solutions. Nearly half our employees have a military background, and approximately 70 percent hold a government security clearance. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nation's defense, security, health, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,100 active contracts with more than 50 different government agencies.

Position: Cost Analyst – DoDLocation - Washington, DC Job Summary This position will provide experienced cost analysis and estimating support for classified Department of Defense programs Years of Relevant Experience The position requires 5-10 years of relevant experience of Cost Estimating experience in the DoD and/or Intelligence Community. Essential Job Functions The following duties are normal for this position. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from this position if the work is similar, related, and/or a logical assignment for this position. Other duties may be required and assigned. Participate in cost teams performing independent cost estimating and cost analysis of classified DoD programs.Assist with identifying and collecting cost data, preparing Work Breakdown Structures, analyzing cost reporting plans, reviewing cost reports, normalizing data, performing statistical regression analysis, learning curve analysis and other analyses, estimating the costs of software development and maintenance, modeling in Microsoft Excel using dynamic formulas, assessing, quantifying, and incorporating cost uncertainty through Monte Carlo discrete event simulation, documenting and presenting results, communicating with stakeholders, and attending various program meetings.Use analysis to support successful program acquisition milestone reviews and prepare/support program budget submittals.Support contract proposal evaluations, negotiations, and acquisition management.Individual will perform cost analyst duties, responsible for overall development, evaluation, and quality assurance of cost estimates, including ad-hoc special studies, in support of investment decisions for information technology systems.Support Earned Value Management (EVM) and Integrated Program Management Reports (IPMR) analysis.Individual will perform cost analysis for program baselines, budget and life cycle cost estimates, feasibility studies and sensitivity analyses, acquisition/contract evaluation and contract solicitation support, and cost performance monitoring and analysis.Individuals will also support process and policy improvement for cost analysis and estimating guidelines.Individuals will be required to contribute effectively to working groups through oral and written communication and cooperative working relationships.Security Requirements Must have DoD Top Secret Security Clearance. Preferred with SCI Eligibility. Education RequirementsBachelor’s degree in a STEM discipline is required.Master’s degree desired.Certified Cost Estimating/Analyst (CCEA) or Professional Cost Estimator/Analyst (PCEA) is desired.Skills RequirementsExperience with Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPointExperience with data collection and analysisAbility to multi–task and work under minimal supervisionExperience with Intelligence Community acquisition process and milestonesPossession of excellent teamwork and collaboration skillsPossession of excellent oral and written communication skillsTravel Occasional travel required as needed by client/s and/or company Total RewardsSalary Range: 80-110k (dependent on experience) Sign-On: This position is eligible for a sign-on bonus up to 10K Benefits:Relax - Recognizing that everyone needs to time to recharge their battery, Cobec offers an impressive combined six weeks of personal, sick, and holiday paid time off (PTO). job_title: Enterprise Data Analyst/Program Analyst (Senior)- F35 JPO
job_description: JOB TITLE: Enterprise Data Analyst/Program Analyst (Senior) F35 JPO PROJECT OVERVIEW: Project provides support to the F-35 Lightning II Joint Strike Fighter Joint Program Office (JPO) located in Crystal City (Arlington), VA. The JPO manages the development, test, production, fielding and sustainment of the F-35 Lightning II Joint Strike Fighter for the USAF, USMC, USN, and International Partner and FMS customer nations worldwide. JOB DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Performs critical program management, technical, or business analysis of major DoD acquisition systems. Provides support for the management of master data management (MDM) to support the standardization of downstream processes and the migration of multiple enterprise applications to a single source for authoritative data. Provide business process, system support and data quality governance for MDM through data coordination and integration to ensure efficient processes and consistent data flows to applications, F-35 JPO users and external stakeholders. Collects, completes, organizes, and interprets technical data and financial information relating to aircraft acquisition and product programs. Synthesizes information into presentations and documents. Tracks program/project status and schedules. Applies policies and procedures for financial planning. REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:Security Clearance:Secret Secret clearanceMS or MA degree in in Business, Management or a degree relevant to the position. ALLOWABLE SUBSTITUTION: A BS or BA degree and an additional four (4) years of relevant experience can be substituted for an MS or MA degree.At least ten (10) years of experience in program management, technical or business analysis discipline; and a minimum of six (6) out of ten (10) years of professional experience in related analysis and planning.At least three (3) years in support of a Major Defense Acquisition Program (MDAP). Familiarity with Service and OSD forms related to PPBS, Military Interdepartmental Procurement Requests, Work Requests, Requisitions, Contract Data Requirements List, and DD254 is required.Demonstrated experience in the program/project status, earned value management and schedules.WORK LOCATION: Crystal City, VA TRAVEL: 5% WBB is a technical and management consulting company that provides innovative products and services that solve government and commercial customers toughest problems. For more than 30 years, WBB has set the standard for excellence in consulting services, while providing its employees with an outstanding work environment with ample opportunities for growth and success. WBB continues to enjoy impressive growth, which is directly attributed to the companys hiring practice of always hiring the very best professionals from government, military and industry.We are proud of our diverse environment and are an Equal Opportunity Employer. WBB is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. WBB participates in E-Verify.WBB does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of WBB and WBB will not be obligated to pay a placement fee.

Data Analyst, Salesforce  Location: Washington DC Metro Area  Benefits Offered: Vision, Medical, Dental, 401K  Employment Offered: Full-TimeJob Description:Swain Techs is seeking a Salesforce Data Analyst to play a role in making the organization more effective and efficient by collecting, analyzing, and leveraging data across departments, automating reports and processes for data-driven decision making, and maintaining and optimizing Salesforce.Responsibilities:Interprets results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining.Designs, develops, implements and maintains business solutions based on Salesforce analytics and experienced using the Salesforce platform.Works directly with clients and project and business leaders to identify analytical requirements.Relies on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.Performs a variety of tasks.A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required.Works under general supervision.Reports to a supervisor or managerEducation/Experience:Requires a bachelor's degree in area of specialty and 6-8 years of experience in the field or in a related area.Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field.Overall knowledge of Enterprise Performance Life Cycle (EPLC) and agile development.Salesforce-certified preferredAbout Swain Techs: Make a difference with Swain Techs. As you consider a career at Swain Techs, you will find countless opportunities to contribute to solutions that are changing the world in real and measurable ways in our technical, engineering, and enterprise IT core business areas.Why Swain Techs?Swain Techs is an award winning 8(a) certified small business with over a decade of exceptional performance.Headquartered in Horsham, PA with offices in Washington, DC., Virginia, Delaware, New York and Florida Swain Techs has been awarded several prime contracts with U.S. Navy-NAVAIR PMA 250, the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), the Defense Logistics Agency (DLA), the Department of Commerce-US Patent and Trade Office (USPTO) and the U.S. Customs and Border Patrol (CBP) We are among the fastest 5000 growing companies in the US for 2014 and 2015 according to Inc. Magazine. We are CMMi ML3 appraised for Development & Services plus Service System Development and ISO 9001:2008 certified.We know that our continued success begins with you. Swain Techs is always looking for bright, energetic, entrepreneurial people to join our team. If you are looking for an exciting environment, where your opinion is highly valued and you are fanatical about customer service, we would love to talk with you.Come and discover what makes Swain Techs a great place to work.  Visit our website http://swaintechs.com/careers
