We are a dynamic, diverse team of digital and social media professionals dedicated to expanding the reach of World Bank’s content, engaging with our audience across channels, and maximizing the impact and influence of World Bank’s development knowledge.BACKGROUND The World Bank Group (WBG) is one of the world's largest sources of funding and knowledge for developing countries. It uses financial resources and extensive experience to help client countries to reduce poverty, increase economic growth, and improve quality of life.  The WBG reaches millions of people across the globe each year with its external website and social media activities. Our digital presence is a symbol of the institution’s transparency and openness, and is our most important tool for sharing knowledge, demonstrating our effectiveness to the world, and engaging with clients. GENERAL DESCRIPTION The External Corporate Relations Web and Social Media unit (ECRWS) manages all public digital assets for the WBG (website, mobile apps, social media channels, etc).  The Digital Analyst is a member of the Business Intelligence Team in ECRWS working closely with other team members (including content producers, communications strategy planners and IT solutions team) to provide insights on the effectiveness of digital communications and marketing strategies. S/he is a trusted advisor in all things related to Digital Analytics and produces data-driven insights and recommendations to improve the impact of digital campaigns.  We are looking for an enthusiastic, organized, self-motivated individual who is driven by data and analytics. The successful candidate is able to discover and articulate actionable insights from large amounts of data. S/he has demonstrated hands-on experience with web analytics tools, ideally Adobe Analytics, the Bank’s web analytics solution, as well as social media monitoring.  This is an Extended Term Full-Time Consultancy for one year, with the possibility of renewal for an additional year. The job is based in Washington, D.C. Interested candidates are requested to send an expression of interest, resume and salary requirements by January 4, 2019 athttps://worldbankgroup.csod.com/ats/careersite/JobDetails.aspx?id=1485Applications submitted without an introductory letter will not be considered.DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES The Digital Analyst is a core member of the Business Intelligence Team in the External Corporate Relations Web and Social Media unit (ECRWS) and reports directly to the team lead. Her/his duties and accountabilities include: 1. Data Interpretation, Insights & StandardsArticulates business insights and actionable recommendations to inform digital marketing campaigns by analyzing large amounts of data (web, social media, multimedia metrics).Establishes enterprise standards for digital analytics, goal-setting frameworks, and KPIs to ensure optimal channel use and campaign optimization.Performs deep-dive analysis for corporate digital marketing campaigns (paid and earned) during the World Bank’s Spring and Annual Meetings as well as other key corporate initiatives; makes campaign optimization recommendations.Analyzes audience level data to understand user behavior across devices, countries, languages and marketing channels.Creates comprehensive and visually attractive metrics reports and dashboards (ad-hoc, monthly, quarterly and end-of-year); identifies trends, opportunities, and insights from these reports and regularly presents recommendations to a team of web editors.2. BI Dashboard and OptimizationActively contributes to the development of a Business Intelligence Dashboard that aggregates data from multiple digital channels to provide a complete picture of communication efforts.Works with the Bank’s Information Technology Solutions team to ensure technical specifications for the web metrics solution (e.g., eVars, Props) and for digital campaigns (e.g., Pixels, CIDs/UTMs) are set up in accordance with the team’s strategic measurement goals.Makes recommendations for optimizing Bank’s web site user experience (UX) and for personalizing content delivery based on insights derived from behavioral, demographical and contextual data.3. Strategic AdvisorAdvises clients across the Bank on best practices for measuring digital communication activities (web, social media and e-mail marketing) and helps them interpret data to create actionable business insights.Develops standardized reporting frameworks (methodology, templates, dashboards, etc.) and advises key clients on how to apply those standards to their digital channels.Review clients’ business objectives to identify and recommend KPIs, and conversion goals to be tracked.Recommends emerging platforms and technologies in the areas of digital analytics and digital marketing.SELECTION CRITERIAEducation:Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Economics, Statistics, Communications, or other related disciplines and 5+ years of relevant experience in web metrics & analytics.Technical: Expert in using web metrics tools including: segment development, understanding dynamic tag management and production of analytic dashboards and calculated metrics. Proficiency with Adobe Analytics latest version and Analysis Workspace will be a plus.Advanced practical knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables and macros, and strong data visualization skills in PowerPoint (Tableau would be an advantage)Advanced knowledge of social media analytics, including paid promotions techniques.Knowledge of social media listening platforms (e.g., Talkwalker, Brandwatch) will be a plus.Ability to identify opportunities from data analysis and to present insights in a concise manner to a diverse stakeholder group.Demonstrated experience in building, managing and creating BI dashboards using modern techniques such as Tableau, Domo or similar tools.InterpersonalStrong communication skills, ability to write persuasively about data and to problem-solve.Strong research/investigative skills.Strong diplomatic, interpersonal and teamwork skills; demonstrated client orientation; sensitivity to working in a multicultural environment.

Position summarySeeking Data Engineers to join our Center for Analytics in Washington, D.C!Work you’ll do Our Client's Center for Analytics is responsible for providing the cross-functional, enterprise-level data analysis and solutions needed to accomplish key policy objectives and make informed decisions. Over the last year, Deloitte has supported the incubation of the Center for Analytics through development and implementation of a strategic vision. This Centers' advanced analytics work stream produces enterprise-level advanced analytics and data-driven decision-support tools for principal executives and stakeholders.  We are looking for Data Engineers to join our growing team of analytics experts. Our selected individuals will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. Ideal candidates are experienced data pipeline builders and data wranglers who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. Our Data Engineers will support our database architects, data analysts, and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects, hence being self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products is a must. The team Systems Engineering  Our Systems Engineering team delivers large-scale software applications and integrated systems, and assists clients with architecture design, assessment and optimization, and definition. We develop service-oriented architecture (SOA) and other integration solutions to enable information sharing and management between business partners and disparate processes and systems, and we deliver technology enablement to support CIO services transformation.  Systems Engineering professionals focus on key client issues that impact the core business by maximizing operational value, driving down the cost of quality, and enhancing technology innovation. Our teams deliver a wide range of services, including application architecture design and optimization, application modernization, business process management and solution integration, custom application design and development, and large-scale technology delivery program efforts. Responsibilities: • Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.  • Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL  • Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights  into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance Qualifications:A minimum of 4 to 6 years of applicable experience coupled with a completed Bachelor's DegreeU.S. Citizenship is required as is an active Top Secret Security ClearanceProven experience working with ANSI SQL, R Studio, Microsoft SQL Server, Database Design and AdministrationHow you’ll grow At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center. Benefits At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you. Deloitte’s culture Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte. Corporate citizenship Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world. Recruiter tips We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.As used in this posting, “Deloitte” means Deloitte Consulting LLP, a subsidiary of Deloitte LLP. National Trust Community Investment Corporation (NTCIC) enables tax credit equity investments that support sustainable communities nationwide. NTCIC raises and invests money in connection with federal and state historic tax credits (HTC), new markets tax credits (NMTC), solar tax credits (ITC), and private equity sources. NTCIC is a wholly owned for-profit subsidiary of the National Trust for Historic Preservation.  NTCIC seeks a Business Systems Analyst to support the IT infrastructure (MSP in place), manage new business system implementations (new phases of Salesforce and document management system), and act as company administrator for business technology applications (Salesforce, custom SQL database, document management). Prior experience in the financial services or related industry is preferred. Duties include: Review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs; document business and systems requirements; define scope and objectives for expanding data management and IT system needs; manage systems development and operations to parallel overall business strategies; and maintain policies and procedures. Works closely with Senior Management and external IT and business application consultants. Responsibilities and Duties: New Systems Implementations and Process Improvement Management  Work directly with stakeholders to understand and interpret multiple IT requirements and operational objectives by studying business functions, gathering information, and evaluating output requirements and formats  Construct workflow charts and diagrams, understand system capabilities, write specifications for system improvements and expanding functionality  Define IT project requirements and technical specifications; identify project milestones, phases and tasks; validate resource requirements; develop cost estimate models; form and lead project team; establish and monitor project budget  Monitor project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, and recommending actions  Monitor and improve data collection and business processes by studying current practices and identifying problems; make recommendations; design and implement modifications with an eye towards simplification for users and improved business processes  Monitor and fix issues with data integration, such as between Salesforce and other IT Tools, when necessary  Understand the "asks", the assumptions, the dependencies and the constraints and translate them into requirements and solutions  Customize internal tools for process improvement and identify areas of possible automation and ensure optimum utilization of resources to improve cross-organizational efficiency and productiveness.  Develop supporting documentation including requirement specifications and use cases, logic and process flows.  Analysis, Metrics, and Measurement Responsibilities  Lead efforts to ensure NTCIC has the right information at the right time to make wellinformed decisions by providing this information and anticipating and leading analyses designing frameworks and undertaking other activities that will enable senior leaders to spend time focused on decision making instead of tracking down information.  Provide recommendations and drive improvement on forecasting process, ensuring firstclass qualitative and quantitative insight on upcoming fundraising opportunities.  Use data-driven analyses and forecasts to create a shared understanding of future opportunities.  Manage reporting and analytics for business divisions (technical, financial and/or marketing) by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends  Create informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement Develop and manage organization-wide dashboards, including organization-wide metrics and tracking progress toward goals  Maintain timely cross-organization reports and Dashboards for board and investor meetings.  Conduct insightful reviews and ad hoc analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reports to identify and investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues  Recommend changes to senior management, including the financial and operational impact, to enable efficiencies and ensure overall quality  Actively participate in the implementation of approved changes  Salesforce and Business Systems Administration  Utilize data to ensure accuracy of information and enhance operational efficiency on a day-to-day-basis  Use business systems tools to analyze data and processes and provide unique business insights which can help inform decision-making  Drive system improvements and monitor and prioritize user adoption  Put in place infrastructure (systems, tools, processes, policy adherence)  Own operational work streams that have systems-wide implications  Data Management Support  Manage data in supporting team with reporting and training, data cleaning, basic analysis, and identifying opportunities for process improvement. Oversee builds and creation of sub-team Dashboards and Reporting as requested, working with those team members to ensure that they have the training to follow up with the data integration.  Coordinate with external IT resources, including MSP, outsourced CIO, and software consultants  Act as administrator for all business systems applications and provide IT infrastructure support.  Qualifications: Bachelors Degree in appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience  Minimum 2-4 years of experience in the financial services or related industry required  Proficiency with Salesforce, SharePoint, and business process design required  o Must be familiar with relational database concepts  o Salesforce Administrator Certification strongly preferred  o Strong reporting and data management skills required  Microsoft Project or Smartsheet experience strongly preferred  Ability to impact operations and effect change without being confrontational  Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive  Ability to work independently and with others  Extremely organized with strong time-management skills Business Analyst top skills & proficiencies: Project Management  Analysis  Teamwork  Process Improvement  Big Picture Thinking  Work Well Under Pressure  Communication  Problem Solving  Critical Thinking  Relationship Building  The National Trust Community Investment Corp. is an equal opportunity organization and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or disability. The National Trust Community Investment Corp. actively seeks opportunities to include members of these groups in its programs and activities. *This is a full-time, permanent position that includes salary and benefits.SDL2017

Job Summary WRI’s Governance Center seeks a part-time, limited term Research Analyst for the Land and Resource Rights (LRR) Initiative’s Community Lands and Industrial Concessions project. This is a new research project aimed at developing practical recommendations for addressing the adverse environmental effects of mining (illegal, informal, industrial) on indigenous and community land. Specifically, research will consider (1) the extent of the threat that mining poses to indigenous and community land in tropical forest countries (likely several countries in the Amazon); (2) the forest cover impacts of mining on indigenous and community lands; and (3) the implications of the research findings for forest management and climate mitigation.  You will be responsible for conducting literature reviews, legal research, and policy analysis relevant to the above research questions. You will conduct your work under the supervision of the Project Manager and in collaboration with the project team and international partners, including WRI staff from the Global Restoration Initiative. After completing the research, you will co-author a WRI Research Report on the principle findings and recommendations. Job ResponsibilitiesResearch & KnowledgeConduct literature reviews of scholarly works and development assistance reports relevant to the project’s primary research questionsConduct legal and policy analysis of national laws with the goal of better understanding legal rights and responsibilities of stakeholders in select countries (likely several countries in the Amazon)Develop 3 to 5 case studies of specific community experiences within mining on their lands in select countriesInterview subject-matter experts and liaising with local and international individuals/organizations with experience helping communities address mining issuesAnalyze the data and information collected via the literature reviews, legal reviews and interviewsIn collaboration with the Project Manager, synthesize research findings into recommendations for forest management and climate mitigationContribute to a signature WRI Research Report on the forest cover impacts of industrial concessions on indigenous community landLiaise with internal and external partners across WRI programs and within selected research countriesParticipate in internal and external meetings, workshops, conferences, and other dissemination activitiesJob QualificationsOne year of full-time work experienceBachelor's Degree required, JD and/or LL.M. preferredPrior experience conducting legal research and policy analysis in the field of environment requiredExperience or demonstrated understanding of land rights, issues facing indigenous peoples, mining, or forest management preferredSpanish speaker highly preferredUS work authorization required. WRI is unable to sponsor visas for this opportunity.How to Apply Applicants must apply through the WRI Careers portal to be considered. Please include a cover letter and writing sample. WRI OverviewWorld Resources Institute (WRI) is an independent, nonprofit global research organization that turns big ideas into action at the nexus of environment, economic opportunity and human well-being. We are working to address seven critical challenges that the world must overcome this decade in order to secure a sustainable future for people and the planet: climate change, energy, food, forests, water, sustainable cities, and the ocean.  We are passionate. We value our diversity of interests, skills and backgrounds. We have a flexible work environment. And we share a common goal to catalyze change that will improve the lives of people. Our shared ideals are at the core of our approach. They include: integrity, innovation, urgency, independence and respect.  The foundation of our work is delivering high-quality research, data, maps and analysis to solve the world’s greatest environment and international development challenges, and improve people’s lives. We work with leaders in government, business and civil society to drive ambitious action and create change on the ground. Equally important, we bring together partners to develop breakthrough ideas and scale-up solutions for far-reaching, enduring impact.  We have been growing rapidly: our staff has doubled in size over the past 5 years and our operating budget is now $100 million. Founded in 1982, WRI has a global staff of 800+ people with work spanning 60 countries. We have offices in Africa, Brazil, China, Europe, India, Indonesia, Mexico and the United States as well as a growing presence in other countries and regions.  WRI is committed to advancing gender and social equity for human well-being in our mission and applies this principle to our organizational and programmatic practices. The World Resources Institute (http://www.wri.org) is an environmental and development research and policy organization that creates solutions to protect the Earth and improve people’s lives. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, it is WRI’s policy to recruit, hire, and provide opportunities for advancement in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, parental status, protected veteran status, or disability. WRI’s global agenda requires a staff that is diverse – with respect to race, gender, cultural, and international background. Diverse perspectives and experience enhance the way WRI selects and approaches issues, as well as the creativity and applicability of WRI's policy research and analysis. WRI, therefore, encourages applications from U.S. minorities, persons from other countries (especially developing nations), and from women of all backgrounds.

Position: Data Scientist Job Purpose: Na Ali’i is looking to hire a Data Scientist to support the DoD Chief Management Office (CMO) and the IT efficiencies and IT/Business Systems Reform initiative. You will analyze and develop data models and visualizations used to assess the viability and potential savings of proposed DoD-wide IT cost-saving initiatives across the BMA. Your analysis and findings will directly support finding efficiencies within the management and internal processes or the “Business-side of IT.” You will be responsible for the collection and interpretation of reporting requirements, design and development of internal and external communication using dashboards, reports, PowerPoint, and graphic output. Job Duties:•Translating mission needs into an end-to-end analytical approach to achieve results. •Performing the pre-analytics areas of data collection and understanding, data cleansing and integration, and data storage and retrieval. •Determining the appropriate analytics based on the data and the desired outcomes, using techniques including feature detection, statistics, data mining, predictive modeling, machine learning, natural language processing, and business intelligence. •Interpreting the validity of results and communicating the meaning of those results. •Demonstrating data analysis and visualization with one or more leading COTS analytic and presentation solutions including Tableau, Qlik Sense, and MS Excel and other MS Office suite applications.•Collaborating with team members and government clients to obtain a detailed understanding of data requirements necessary for the sampling, weighting, and analysis of data.•Working with other analysts in the creation, cleaning, and recoding of datasets and sample frames for IT Reform Initiatives (e.g. IT Cost Model Analysis). •Ensuring data and metadata integrity and compliance with required standards by performing data validation and cleansing. •Identifying issues within data and determining the root cause of the problem to recommend and execute corrective action.•Identifying and implementing process improvements in relation to data collection and processing for repeatability.•Identifying, reviewing and evaluating data collection metrics. Recommending ways to strengthen data integrity, quality, and availability.•Providing project management support and ensures completion of all final deliverables in a timely, accurate, and efficient fashion.•Extensive experience with working in an environment involving diverse sets of legacy data, documents, and materials. Experience with data preparation.•Familiarity with R based statistics. Knowledge of statistical analysis methods including linear regression and factor analysis.•Experience with all lifecycle phases of a data-oriented business case development project including initial assessment, requirements, solution design, planning and implementation.Skills/Qualifications: Excellent technical skills, organizational and planning skills, communication, and problem-solving skills, Problem analysis, attention to detail and accuracy, solid judgment and decision-making ability, takes initiative and is adaptable and customer service oriented. Qualified candidates should possess the following skill sets and experience: •Three years of experience working with large datasets or databases. At least two of those years should be in a professional working environment.•Experience supporting a Federal CIO Organization or Department. •Strong quantitative ability and a keen eye for detail and accuracy.•Proficiency writing syntax and using statistics and data analysist tools such as SPSS or Stata, R, Tableau, Qlik Sense, or other leading BI platform (Cognos, Business Objects), R Statistical programming and methods, Oracle or MS SQL Integration required. •Ability to multi-task and manage multiple priorities with minimum direction and supervision.•Effective written and oral communication skills leveraging the MS Office suite of applications – with a strong Excel background.•Experience using algorithms related to machine learning or data analytics. •Experience developing and testing models. •Experience conducting model feasibility research and algorithm development for machine learning. •Experience working in an Agile environment, especially SAFe. •Experience working with the Atlassian tool suite (Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence) •Experience working in the commercial AWS or government C2S computing environments Education and Experience: This position requires a Bachelor’s degree or higher in statistics, mathematics, social science, or an equivalent related field. A minimum of three (3) years of relevant professional experience is required. Experience working in or directly for the DoD is preferred. Clearance Requirements: This position requires an active SECRET security clearance.Na Ali`i Is Proud to Be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

The individual would work with teams to identify their analysis needs and data availability, and then evaluate their current analysis practices. They would then propose improvements in data curation and analysis to enable to team to perform their jobs faster and more consistently. They might prototype the workflows and teach the team how to continue the processes.  Primary Responsibilities  Developing new workflows to improve existing analyses.  Teaching data management best practices to those who lack formal training in analysis.  Determine how to collect data in a formal and systematic manner.  Help to determine next-generation data collection and analysis needs, such as web forms, online database, etc.  Helping groups understand the sorts of analyses that could be performed with the data that they already collect, as well as what additional data would be needed to perform the sorts of analyses that they desire.  Creating sample informational products based on existing data to demonstrate the art of the possible. Experience with R and Python scripting and related packages for processing, analyzing, and visualizing data.  Familiarity with geographic information systems (GIS).  Experience developing succinct visualizations of geographic, time series, and proportion data.  Excellent written and oral communication skills.  Preferred Qualifications  MA or MS in mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, statistics, epidemiology, or a related discipline or an additional 2-4 years' experience (4-8 total).  Experience managing and deploying databases.  Experience with emergency management and response.  Experience using Git and other source code management tools.  Experience working with cloud computing infrastructure, particularly in a Federal IT environment.  Experience with IT solutions in potentially low-resource environments (lacking reliable power and internet access for example).  Experience with electronic health record systems, ESRI GIS products, Tableau.

Job Description:JOB DESCRIPTION: The Senior Network Analysts experience in all-source, criminal, network/link and financial analysis. Analysts shall perform continuous research, collection, predictive analysis, multimedia production, and dissemination to support Narcotics and Transnational Crime (NTC) support center; focus on assigned region of the world and on functional topics, including narcotics trafficking, terrorism, weapons proliferation, money laundering, and cyber threats; fuse all-source intelligence and law enforcement agency (LEA) data into actionable intelligence products that support tactical and operational efforts for LEA/Interagency (IA) mission partners. Contractor personnel at a minimum shall:Provide support to LEAs, DoD elements, government IA as well as foreign partners in conducting complex, multinational, multi-faceted operations and investigations in conjunction with interagency host nation counterparts to counter transnational crime with a narcotics or terrorism nexusIdentify and analyze plans and actions for counternarcotics (CN), counter-terrorism (CT), counter threat finance (CTF), and counter transnational crime (C-TOC) activities; assist in preparation and coordination with intelligence and operational activities, Global Combatant Commands (GCCs), other DoD and USG agencies, partner nations, and/or public/private sector as required.Monitor and provide advice on CN, CTF, and C-TOC assessments to support DoD and/or IA development of case files, evidentiary material, designation packages, including actionable intelligence on specific entitiesDevelop briefings, reports, and short notice position papers; review and compile reports to prepare leadership and managementFacilitate information sharing among GCCs, other DoD agencies, LEA, IA, and partner nations, public/private sector partners; attend and/or support meetings, briefings, coordination sessions, conferences, and required forums regarding CN, CT, CTF, and C-TOC issuesAssist in identification of CN, CTF, and C-TOC intelligence requirements and capabilities among DoD and USG agencies in coordination with LEA/IA partnersDemonstrate proficiency and perform tasks in state-of-the-art hardware and software applications to incorporate data mining, data manipulation, link/nodal analysis, graphics, and multimedia production technologiesExperience with Analyst's Notebook (ANB) EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE: Requires a BA degree and 4 - 8 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 2 - 6 years of prior relevant experience. Additional Experience Requirements:Must be able to:Prepare intelligence documents through intelligence gathering using multiple intelligence sources such as HUMINT, SIGINT, GEOINT, MASINT, and OSINT to support customers, including military, intelligence, LEA, or security agencies.Recommend process improvements or enhancements to processes.Support the processing of incoming reports and messages, determining significance and reliability of incoming information. Analyze current intelligence holdings, identify potential shortfalls, gaps, and vulnerabilities to develop subsequent collection requirements.Monitor and maintain awareness of operational traffic relating to functional or regional areas regarding CN, CT, CTF, and C-TOC operations; provide illicit network infrastructure mapping on established targets and identify new targets;Develop complex analytical approaches to problems and situations for which data is incomplete, controversial, or for which no precedent exists.Extract, analyze, store, and incorporate data into finished intelligence productsAssist government/NTC in providing formal and informal training specifically addressing LE regulatory and administrative aspects of the C-TOC, CN, and CTF mission sets

Job Number: R0040752 Data Science Database Analyst, MidThe Challenge: Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open up new opportunities. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors from fraud detection, to cancer research, to national intelligence you know the answers are in the data.  We have an opportunity for you to use your analytical skills to improve the Department of Defense's management of multiple data sources. Youll work closely with your customer to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environment to find the pieces of their information puzzle. Youll develop algorithms, write scripts, build dynamic dashboards and visualization tools, and apply machine learning turn a set of disparate data points into objective answers to help the most senior leaders in the Department of Defense make informed decisions. Youll provide your customer with a deep understanding of their data, what it all means, and how they can use it. Join us as we use data science for good in our mission to provide cutting-edge analytics and data science methods to our nation's defense leadership.  Empower change with us. Build Your Career: At Booz Allen, we know the power of analytics and were dedicated to helping you grow as a data analysis professional. When you join Booz Allen, you can expect: access to online and onsite training in data analysis and presentation methodologies, and tools like Hortonworks, Docker, Tableau, and Splunka chance to change the world with the Data Science Bowlthe worlds premier data science for social good competitionparticipation in partnerships with data science leaders, like our partnership with NVIDIA to deliver Deep Learning Institute (DLI) training to the federal government Youll have access to a wealth of training resources through our Analytics University, an online learning portal specifically geared towards data science and analytics skills, where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and state-of-the-art tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications? Take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site bootcamps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. Well help you develop the career you want, as you chart your own course for success. You Have:5 years of experience in an OSD, Joint staff, or equivalent strategic corporate or governmental analysis roleExperience with statistics, mathematics, data engineering, machine learning, or visualizationExperience with creating and maintaining large data setsExperience with SQLActive Secret clearanceBA or BS degree in Mathematics, Operations Research, CS, Data Science, Science, Technology, or Engineering Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.  Were an EOE that empowers our peopleno matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or veteran statusto fearlessly drive change.

job_title: Senior Policy Analyst, Policy Analysis Center
job_description: OPEN: ImmediatelyLOCATION: Washington, DC CLOSE: Until filled CONTACT: Samantha Vargas Poppe, Associate Director, Policy Analysis Center SALARY: Commensurate with experienceBACKGROUNDUnidosUS, previously known as NCLR (National Council of La Raza), is the nation’s largest Hispanic civil rights and advocacy organization. Through its unique combination of expert research, advocacy, programs, and an Affiliate Network of nearly 300 community-based organizations across the United States and Puerto Rico, UnidosUS simultaneously challenges the social, economic, and political barriers that affect Latinos at the national and local levels. For 50 years, UnidosUS has united communities and different groups seeking common ground through collaboration, and that share a desire to make our community stronger. For more information on UnidosUS, visit www.unidosus.org or follow us on Facebook and Twitter.SUMMARYThe Senior Policy Analyst, Policy Analysis Center will work as a member of the Policy Analysis Center (PAC) to work on issues that cut across UnidosUS's core policy project teams, including the economy, education, and health. The Senior Policy Analyst will work to increase awareness of issues and develop innovative public policy and program solutions. They will identify and make recommendations on promising new reform ideas by providing highly skilled analysis of public policy trends. They will work with colleagues and, as appropriate, independently, to design and conduct analyses of data and programs and to write policy papers, statistical briefs, fact sheets, and testimony for a variety of audiences. They will also represent UnidosUS while working with a diverse group of experts, researchers, educators, media, and policymakers at the federal, state, and local levels. The Senior Policy Analyst will also have to foster and maintain collaboration with colleagues in multiple internal disciplines, including Communications and Marketing, Civic Engagement, and Legislative Affairs.RESPONSIBILITIESWork with the Director, PAC, to develop and execute a project plan and agenda for evaluating and analyzing relevant public and social policies that affect the Latino community.Analyze emerging public policy issues and trends, including those in economic security, and produce high-quality issue briefs, conference papers, presentations, and testimony that meet UnidosUS's standards and are appropriate to the established purpose and target audience.Aid and guide policy project teams on discrete projects and conduct in-dept h, cross-cutting projects that bring together several policy areas in a cohesive and compelling manner that supports proactive policy recommendations.Develop relationships and connections with community leaders and other stakeholders to collaborate with these groups in addressing issues and solving problems and serve as an UnidosUS institutional expert on relevant policy solutions that improve the economic security and well-being of Latino communities.Represent UnidosUS in forums, including delivering presentations before congressional staff, policymakers, issue experts and stakeholders, national conferences, and the media.QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor ' s degree required. Master' s degree preferred in public policy or relevant area.At least four to five years of experience with policy analysis, including relevant analytical (qualitative and quantitative) methodologies.Demonstrated writing ability, including developing and writing articles, studies, reports, or other publicly available documents strongly preferred.Experience communicating policy ideas in public settings such as coalition meetings, congressional hearings and briefings, major conferences, and with the media.Capacity to work effectively under tight deadlines by taking initiative, coordinating multiple projects, and working as part of a team or independently.Displayed commitment to social justice and UnidosUS's mission.Bilingual ability (English/Spanish) a plus.Flexibility for occasional travel.Please include “Senior Policy Analyst, Policy Analysis Center” in the subject line of your email.SEND COVER LETTER, WRITING SAMPLE AND RÉSUMÉ TO: UnidosUSRaul Yzaguirre BuildingAttn: Samantha Vargas Poppe1126 16th Street, NW, Suite 600Washington, DC 20036Email: oral-admin@unidosus.orgNo phone calls please!EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. More than 30 years ago, E*TRADE pioneered the online brokerage industry by executing the first-ever electronic individual investor trade. While the landscape of our industry has changed dramatically, our culture of innovation and drive to make online trading accessible to everyone continues to drive us forward. We believe in challenging the status quo, fostering an environment of curiosity and learning, and, above all, putting our customers first. Summary The Senior Analyst will be a vital a member of the Data Risk Office. Responsibilities include supporting the implementation of data governance principles throughout the firm. Program activities include, but are not limited to, supporting the coordination, collection and documentation of business glossaries, technical data dictionaries, data lineage, and data quality controls in collaboration with various data stewards within the firm. Additionally, this individual will measure program compliance with firm wide standards, and assist in the creation and development of an enterprise-wide metadata repository utilizing a digital asset management tool. If you like the idea of helping clients achieve financial security and youre a whiz at calculations and data analysis, an actuarial career at Mercer might be a great fit for you. For more than 70 years, weve turned our insights into actions, enabling people around the globe to live, work, and retire well. This position is on the consultant staff of LMI, a private management consulting organization located in McLean, VA that provides solutions to the federal government. The position will be located in the Springfield, VA area.  This position will provide subject matter expertise support in the facilities/infrastructure and data analysis areas as it relates to facilities systems, master planning, and strategic assessments. In addition, the position includes facility data collection, analysis of condition assessments, review and evaluation of project status, prioritization of funding, and development of unfunded priority project listings. Communication with the customer’s mid-level and senior-level staff, and collaboration with a broad range of engineering and operations personnel is required. Responsibilities of the position may include:Serve as the Facility Condition Assessment Lead;Review Facility Condition Assessments/ReassessmentsProcess and maintain associated documentationAct as liaison between Facilities, Construction, and Project Management branchesServe as a database steward, responsible for managing data quality in an ARCHIBUS database environment;Act as the nexus between database administration and IT support to ensure adherence to security and disaster recovery, personnel control, physical access controls, maintenance controls, and data protection and privacyCombine data, processes, and tools to help plan and manage facilities strategicallyPerform record keeping and data maintenancePerform associated software trainingGenerate reports and briefings/presentations for management and senior leadershipPerform SharePoint administrationAssist with all facets of facilities Operations and Maintenance workBachelor's degree and 3+ year's of relevant work experienceDemonstrated critical/strategic thinking to help client effectively manage daily operationsDemonstrated ability to work in an independent setting performing detailed analysisExperience with SharePoint design and functionalityFamiliarity with ARCHIBUS and BUILDER software/programsStrong communication skills and customer service acumenProficiency with Microsoft Office productsSecurity Clearance Statement: Applicants selected for this position will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. For this position, LMI will only consider applicants with current security clearances. Please note that only US Citizens are eligible for a security clearance. Minimum of TS/SCI clearance is required. A TS/SCI CI Poly is desired.

Description: ShadowObjects, LLC currently has a full-time job opening for a Mid-Level to Senior-Level Acquisition Data Analyst who will provide support to the Deputy Assistant Secretary of the Navy- Acquisition and Policy (DASN AP). This position is located at the Pentagon in Arlington, VA. Job Duties/Responsibilities: Under general direction and guidance, the successful candidate will support strategic decision-making at the Echelon I command. Support will include engaging with high-level stakeholders, recording and documenting decisions, and providing ad-hoc support to a small Government team. Technical Requirements:Applicants must possess strong communication skills; the ability to communicate effectively both through discussions and via documentation is critical to success; samples may be requestedApplicants must be comfortable with taking the initiative and determining the best path forward given multiple valid approaches; critical thinking and the ability to inform decision making are requiredApplicants should have a strong understanding of data trends and reporting capabilities; knowledge of implementing a data-standard approach across multiple systems and leveraging data visualization toolsets (e.g., Tableau) is requiredApplicants must have a strong attention to detail, be able to track multiple projects at once, and deliver quality products within short (often 24-hour or less) deadlinesApplicant must be able to work independently and with little-to-no oversightApplicants that have existing knowledge of the DON acquisition and contract writing processes are highly preferredApplicants with previous work experience within the Navy or the DoD preferredEducation Requirements: Bachelors Degree Required Security Clearance Requirement: Secret  Job Type: Full-time  Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required)
